TEXT_IN.description: Stores the source data when the AES Accelerator operates in the Typical AES working mode.

TEXT_OUT.description: Stores the result data when the AES Accelerator operates in the Typical AES working mode.

MODE.description:
Defines the operation type of the AES Accelerator operating under the Typical AES working mode.
&
0x0(AES_EN_128): AES-EN-128 #
0x1(AES_EN_192): AES-EN-192 #
0x2(AES_EN_256): AES-EN-256 #
0x4(AES_DE_128): AES-DE-128 #
0x5(AES_DE_192): AES-DE-192 #
0x6(AES_DE_256): AES-DE-256 
&

ENDIAN.description:
Defines the endianness of input and output texts.
&
[1:0] key endian #
[3:2] text_in endian or in_stream endian #
[5:4] text_out endian or out_stream endian #
&

TRIGGER.description: Set this bit to 1 to start AES operation.

STATE.description:
Stores the working status of the AES Accelerator. For details, see Table 3 for Typical AES working mode and Table 9 for DMA AES working mode.
For typical AES; 0 = idle; 1 = busy.
For DMA-AES; 0 = idle; 1 = busy; 2 = calculation_done.

IV.description: This register stores the %sth 32-bit piece of 128-bit initialization vector

J0.description: This register stores the %sth 32-bit piece of 128-bit J0

T0.description: This register stores the %sth 32-bit piece of 128-bit T0

DMA_ENABLE.description:
Defines the working mode of the AES Accelerator. For details, see Table 1.
1'h0: typical AES operation
1'h1: DMA-AES operation

BLOCK_MODE.description:
Defines the operation type of the AES Accelerator operating under the DMA-AES working mode. For details, see Table 8.
&
3'h0(BLOCK_MODE_ECB): ECB #
3'h1(BLOCK_MODE_CBC): CBC #
3'h2(BLOCK_MODE_OFB): OFB #
3'h3(BLOCK_MODE_CTR): CTR #
3'h4(BLOCK_MODE_CFB8): CFB-8 #
3'h5(BLOCK_MODE_CFB128): CFB-128 #
3'h6(BLOCK_MODE_GCM): GCM
&

BLOCK_NUM.description: Stores the Block Number of plaintext or cipertext when the AES Accelerator operates under the DMA-AES working mode. For details, see Section 1.5.4.

INC_SEL.description: Defines the Standard Incrementing Function for CTR block operation. Set this bit to 0 or 1 to choose INC 32 or INC 128 .

AAD_BLOCK_NUM.description: Stores the ADD Block Number for the GCM operation.

REMAINDER_BIT_NUM.description: Stores the Remainder Bit Number for the GCM operation.

CONTINUE_OP.description: Set this bit to 1 to continue AES operation.

INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to 1 to clear AES interrupt.

INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable AES interrupt and 0 to disable interrupt.

DMA_EXIT.description: Set this bit to 1 to exit AES operation. This register is only effective for DMA-AES operation.

FSM_WAIT.description: configure saradc fsm internal parameter base on test

SAR1_PATT_TAB1.description: item 0 ~ 3 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR1_PATT_TAB2.description: Item 4 ~ 7 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR1_PATT_TAB3.description: Item 8 ~ 11 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR1_PATT_TAB4.description: Item 12 ~ 15 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB1.description: item 0 ~ 3 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB2.description: Item 4 ~ 7 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB3.description: Item 8 ~ 11 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB4.description: Item 12 ~ 15 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

ARB_CTRL.description: Configure the settings of DIG ADC2 arbiter

FILTER_CTRL.description: Configure the settings of DIG ADC2 filter

FILTER_STATUS.description: Data status of DIG ADC2 filter

THRES_CTRL.description: Configure monitor threshold for DIG ADC2

START_FORCE.description: 0: select FSM to start SAR ADC. 1: select software to start SAR ADC.

WORK_MODE.description:
0: single-channel scan mode. 1: double-channel scan mode. 2:
alternate-channel scan mode.

SAR_SEL.description: 0: select SAR ADC1. 1: select SAR ADC2, only work for single-channel scan mode.

SAR1_PATT_P_CLEAR.description: Clear the pointer of pattern table for DIG ADC1 CTRL.

SAR2_PATT_P_CLEAR.description: Clear the pointer of pattern table for DIG ADC2 CTRL.

DATA_SAR_SEL.description: 1: sar_sel will be coded to the MSB of the 16-bit output data, in this case the resolution should not be larger than 11 bits.

DATA_TO_I2S.description: 1: I2S input data is from SAR ADC (for DMA), 0: I2S input data is from GPIO matrix

XPD_SAR_FORCE.description: Force option to xpd sar blocks.

WAIT_ARB_CYCLE.description: Wait arbit signal stable after sar_done.

MEAS_NUM_LIMIT.description: Enable limit times of SAR ADC sample.

SAR1_INV.description: 1: data to DIG ADC1 CTRL is inverted, otherwise not.

SAR2_INV.description: 1: data to DIG ADC2 CTRL is inverted, otherwise not.

SAR1_PATT_TAB1.description: item 0 ~ 3 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR1_PATT_TAB2.description: Item 4 ~ 7 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR1_PATT_TAB3.description: Item 8 ~ 11 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR1_PATT_TAB4.description: Item 12 ~ 15 for pattern table 1 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB1.description: item 0 ~ 3 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB2.description: Item 4 ~ 7 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB3.description: Item 8 ~ 11 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

SAR2_PATT_TAB4.description: Item 12 ~ 15 for pattern table 2 (each item one byte)

ADC_ARB_APB_FORCE.description: ADC2 arbiter forces to enable DIG ADC2 CTRL.

ADC_ARB_RTC_FORCE.description: ADC2 arbiter forces to enable RTC ADC2 CTRL.

ADC_ARB_WIFI_FORCE.description: ADC2 arbiter forces to enable PWDET/PKDET CTRL.

ADC2_FILTER_FACTOR.description: Set filter factor for DIG ADC2 CRTL.

ADC1_FILTER_FACTOR.description: Set filter factor for DIG ADC1 CRTL.

ADC2_THRES_MODE.description: 1: ADC_DATA > = threshold, generate interrupt. 0: ADC_DATA < threshold, generate interrupt.

ADC1_THRES_MODE.description: 1: ADC_DATA > = threshold, generate interrupt. 0: ADC_DATA < threshold, generate interrupt.

APB_ADC_EOF_NUM.description: Generate dma_in_suc_eof when sample cnt = spi_eof_num.

APB_ADC_TRANS.description: Set this bit, DIG ADC CTRL uses SPI DMA.

CLK_SEL.description: 1: select APLL. 2: select APB_CLK. Other values: disable clock.

OUT_CPU.description: Dedicated GPIO output mode selection register

IN_DLY.description: Dedicated GPIO input delay configuration register

INTR_RCGN.description: Dedicated GPIO interrupts generation mode register

VLAUE.description: This register is used to configure directive output value of 8-channel dedicated GPIO.

OUT_VALUE.description: This register is used to configure updated output value of 8-channel dedicated GPIO.

OUT_MSK.description: This register is used to configure channels which would be updated. 1: corresponding channel's output would be updated.

CH0.description: Configure channel 0 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH1.description: Configure channel 1 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH2.description: Configure channel 2 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH3.description: Configure channel 3 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH4.description: Configure channel 4 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH5.description: Configure channel 5 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH6.description: Configure channel 6 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

CH7.description: Configure channel 7 output value. 0: hold output value. 1: set output value. 2: clear output value. 3: inverse output value.

OUT_STATUS.description: GPIO out value configured by DEDIC_GPIO_OUT_DRT_REG, DEDIC_GPIO_OUT_MSK_REG, DEDIC_GPIO_OUT_IDV_REG.

SEL0.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 0. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL1.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 1. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL2.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 2. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL3.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 3. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL4.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 4. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL5.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 5. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL6.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 6. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

SEL7.description: Select GPIO out value configured by registers or CPU instructions for channel 7. 0: Configured by registers. 1: configured by CPU instructions.

CH0.description: Configure GPIO0 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH1.description: Configure GPIO1 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH2.description: Configure GPIO2 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH3.description: Configure GPIO3 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH4.description: Configure GPIO4 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH5.description: Configure GPIO5 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH6.description: Configure GPIO6 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

CH7.description: Configure GPIO7 input delay. 0: no delay. 1: one clock delay. 2: two clock delay. 3: three clock delay.

IN_STATUS.description: GPIO input value after configured by DEDIC_GPIO_IN_DLY_REG.

INTR_MODE_CH0.description:
Configure channel 0 interrupt generate mode. 
0/1: do not generate interrupt. 
2: low level trigger.
3: high level trigger. 
4: falling edge trigger. 
5: raising edge trigger. 
6/7: falling and raising edge trigger.

INTR_MODE_CH1.description:
Configure channel 1 interrupt generate mode. 
0/1: do not generate interrupt. 
2: low level trigger.
3: high level trigger. 
4: falling edge trigger. 
5: raising edge trigger. 
6/7: falling and raising edge trigger.

INTR_MODE_CH2.description:
Configure channel 2 interrupt generate mode. 
0/1: do not generate interrupt. 
2: low level trigger.
3: high level trigger. 
4: falling edge trigger. 
5: raising edge trigger. 
6/7: falling and raising edge trigger.

INTR_MODE_CH5.description:

INTR_MODE_CH6.description:

INTR_MODE_CH7.description:
Configure channel 7 interrupt generate mode.

4: falling edge trigger. 
5: raising edge trigger. 
6/7: falling and raising edge trigger.

GPIO0.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO0 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO1.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO1 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO2.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO2 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO3.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO3 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO4.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO4 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO5.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO5 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO6.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO6 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO7.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when dedicated GPIO7 has level/edge change configured by DEDIC_GPIO_INTR_RCGN_REG.

GPIO0_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO0_INT_ST register.

GPIO1_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO1_INT_ST register.

GPIO2_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO2_INT_ST register.

GPIO3_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO3_INT_ST register.

GPIO4_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO4_INT_ST register.

GPIO5_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO5_INT_ST register.

GPIO6_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO6_INT_ST register.

GPIO7_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ST register.

GPIO0_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO0_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO1_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO1_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO2_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO2_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO3_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO3_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO4_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO4_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO5_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO5_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO6_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO6_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO7_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_RAW when DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GPIO0_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO0_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO1_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO1_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO2_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO2_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO3_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO3_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO4_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO4_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO5_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO5_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO6_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO6_INT_RAW interrupt.

GPIO7_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the DEDIC_GPIO7_INT_RAW interrupt.

QUERY_KEY_WRONG.description: Checks the reason why DS_KEY is not ready.

SET_START.description: Write 1 to this register to activate the DS peripheral.

SET_ME.description: Write 1 to this register to start DS operation.

SET_FINISH.description: Write 1 to this register to end DS operation.

QUERY_BUSY.description: 1: The DS peripheral is busy. 0: The DS peripheral is idle.

QUERY_KEY_WRONG.description: 1-15: HMAC was activated, but the DS peripheral did not successfully receive the DS_KEY value from the HMAC peripheral. The biggest value is 15. 0: HMAC is not activated.

MD_ERROR.description: 1: MD check fails. 0: MD check passes.

PADDING_BAD.description: 1: The padding check fails. 0: The padding check passes.

PGM_DATA%s.description: Register %s that stores data to be programmed.

PGM_CHECK_VALUE%s.description: Register %s that stores the RS code to be programmed.

RD_REPEAT_ERR0.description: Programming error record register 0 of BLOCK0.

RD_REPEAT_ERR1.description: Programming error record register 1 of BLOCK0.

RD_REPEAT_ERR2.description: Programming error record register 2 of BLOCK0.

RD_REPEAT_ERR3.description: Programming error record register 3 of BLOCK0.

RD_REPEAT_ERR4.description: Programming error record register 4 of BLOCK0.

RD_RS_ERR0.description: Programming error record register 0 of BLOCK1-10.

RD_RS_ERR1.description: Programming error record register 1 of BLOCK1-10.

WR_TIM_CONF0.description: Configuration register 0 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

WR_TIM_CONF1.description: Configuration register 1 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

WR_TIM_CONF2.description: Configuration register 2 of eFuse programming timing parameters.

PGM_DATA.description: The content of the %sth 32-bit data to be programmed.

PGM_RS_DATA.description: The content of the %sth 32-bit RS code to be programmed.

RD_DIS.description: Disables software reading from individual eFuse blocks (BLOCK4-10).

DIS_ICACHE.description: Set this bit to disable Icache.

DIS_DCACHE.description: Set this bit to disable Dcache.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_ICACHE.description: Disables Icache when SoC is in Download mode.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_DCACHE.description: Disables Dcache when SoC is in Download mode.

DIS_FORCE_DOWNLOAD.description: Set this bit to disable the function that forces chip into download mode.

DIS_USB.description: Set this bit to disable USB OTG function.

DIS_CAN.description: Set this bit to disable the TWAI Controller function.

DIS_BOOT_REMAP.description: Disables capability to Remap RAM to ROM address space.

SOFT_DIS_JTAG.description: Software disables JTAG. When software disabled, JTAG can be activated temporarily by HMAC peripheral.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: Disables flash encryption when in download boot modes.

USB_DREFH.description: Controls single-end input threshold vrefh, 1.76 V to 2 V with step of 80 mV, stored in eFuse.

USB_DREFL.description: Controls single-end input threshold vrefl, 0.8 V to 1.04 V with step of 80 mV, stored in eFuse.

USB_EXCHG_PINS.description: Set this bit to exchange USB D+ and D- pins.

EXT_PHY_ENABLE.description: Set this bit to enable external USB PHY.

USB_FORCE_NOPERSIST.description: If set, forces USB BVALID to 1.

VDD_SPI_MODECURLIM.description: SPI regulator switches current limit mode.

VDD_SPI_XPD.description: If VDD_SPI_FORCE is 1, this value determines if the VDD_SPI regulator is powered on.

VDD_SPI_TIEH.description: If VDD_SPI_FORCE is 1, determines VDD_SPI voltage. 0: VDD_SPI connects to 1.8 V LDO. 1: VDD_SPI connects to VDD_RTC_IO.

VDD_SPI_FORCE.description: Set this bit to use XPD_VDD_PSI_REG and VDD_SPI_TIEH to configure VDD_SPI LDO.

VDD_SPI_EN_INIT.description: Set SPI regulator to 0 to configure init[1:0]=0.

VDD_SPI_ENCURLIM.description: Set SPI regulator to 1 to enable output current limit.

VDD_SPI_DCURLIM.description: Tunes the current limit threshold of SPI regulator when tieh=0, about 800 mA/(8+d).

VDD_SPI_INIT.description: Adds resistor from LDO output to ground. 0: no resistance. 1: 6 K. 2: 4 K. 3: 2 K.

WDT_DELAY_SEL.description: Selects RTC watchdog timeout threshold at startup. 0: 40,000 slow clock cycles. 1: 80,000 slow clock cycles. 2: 160,000 slow clock cycles. 3: 320,000 slow clock cycles.

SPI_BOOT_CRYPT_CNT.description: Enables encryption and decryption, when an SPI boot mode is set. Feature is enabled 1 or 3 bits are set in the eFuse, disabled otherwise.

SECURE_BOOT_KEY_REVOKE0.description: If set, revokes use of secure boot key digest 0.

SECURE_BOOT_KEY_REVOKE1.description: If set, revokes use of secure boot key digest 1.

SECURE_BOOT_KEY_REVOKE2.description: If set, revokes use of secure boot key digest 2.

KEY_PURPOSE_0.description: Purpose of KEY0. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

KEY_PURPOSE_1.description: Purpose of KEY1. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

KEY_PURPOSE_2.description: Purpose of KEY2. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

KEY_PURPOSE_3.description: Purpose of KEY3. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

KEY_PURPOSE_4.description: Purpose of KEY4. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

KEY_PURPOSE_5.description: Purpose of KEY5. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

KEY_PURPOSE_6.description: Purpose of KEY6. Refer to Table Key Purpose Values.

SECURE_BOOT_EN.description: Set this bit to enable secure boot.

SECURE_BOOT_AGGRESSIVE_REVOKE.description: Set this bit to enable aggressive secure boot key revocation mode.

FLASH_TPUW.description: Configures flash startup delay after SoC power-up, in unit of (ms/2). When the value is 15, delay is 7.5 ms.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MODE.description: Set this bit to disable all download boot modes.

DIS_LEGACY_SPI_BOOT.description: Set this bit to disable Legacy SPI boot mode.

UART_PRINT_CHANNEL.description: Selects the default UART for printing boot messages. 0: UART0. 1: UART1.

DIS_USB_DOWNLOAD_MODE.description: Set this bit to disable use of USB OTG in UART download boot mode.

ENABLE_SECURITY_DOWNLOAD.description: Set this bit to enable secure UART download mode (read/write flash only).

UART_PRINT_CONTROL.description: Set the default UART boot message output mode. 00: Enabled. 01: Enable when GPIO46 is low at reset. 10: Enable when GPIO46 is high at reset. 11: Disabled.

PIN_POWER_SELECTION.description: Set default power supply for GPIO33-GPIO37, set when SPI flash is initialized. 0: VDD3P3_CPU. 1: VDD_SPI.

FLASH_TYPE.description: SPI flash type. 0: maximum four data lines, 1: eight data lines.

FORCE_SEND_RESUME.description: If set, forces ROM code to send an SPI flash resume command during SPI boot.

SECURE_VERSION.description: Secure version (used by ESP-IDF anti-rollback feature).

MAC_0.description: Stores the low 32 bits of MAC address.

MAC_1.description: Stores the high 16 bits of MAC address.

SPI_PAD_CONF_0.description: Stores the zeroth part of SPI_PAD_CONF.

SPI_PAD_CONF_1.description: Stores the first part of SPI_PAD_CONF.

SPI_PAD_CONF_2.description: Stores the second part of SPI_PAD_CONF.

SYS_DATA_PART0_0.description: Stores the zeroth part  of the zeroth part of system data.

SYS_DATA_PART0_1.description: Stores the fist part of the zeroth part of system data.

SYS_DATA_PART0_2.description: Stores the second part of the zeroth part of system data.

SYS_DATA_PART1.description: Stores the %sth 32 bits of the first part of system data.

SYS_DATA_PART2.description: Stores the %sth 32 bits of the 2nd part of system data.

RD_DIS_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_RD_DIS.

DIS_RTC_RAM_BOOT_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_RTC_RAM_BOOT.

DIS_ICACHE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_ICACHE.

DIS_DCACHE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_DCACHE.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_ICACHE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_DOWNLOAD_ICACHE.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_DCACHE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_DOWNLOAD_DCACHE.

DIS_FORCE_DOWNLOAD_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_FORCE_DOWNLOAD.

DIS_USB_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_USB.

DIS_CAN_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_CAN.

DIS_BOOT_REMAP_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_BOOT_REMAP.

RPT4_RESERVED5_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_RPT4_RESERVED5.

SOFT_DIS_JTAG_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_SOFT_DIS_JTAG.

HARD_DIS_JTAG_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_HARD_DIS_JTAG.

DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.

USB_DREFH_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_USB_DREFH.

USB_DREFL_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_USB_DREFL.

USB_EXCHG_PINS_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_USB_EXCHG_PINS.

EXT_PHY_ENABLE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_EXT_PHY_ENABLE.

USB_FORCE_NOPERSIST_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_USB_FORCE_NOPERSIST.

RPT4_RESERVED0_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_RPT4_RESERVED0.

VDD_SPI_MODECURLIM_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_MODECURLIM.

VDD_SPI_DREFH_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_DREFH.

VDD_SPI_DREFM_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_DREFM.

VDD_SPI_DREFL_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_DREFL.

VDD_SPI_XPD_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_XPD.

VDD_SPI_TIEH_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_TIEH.

VDD_SPI_FORCE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_FORCE.

VDD_SPI_EN_INIT_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_EN_INIT.

VDD_SPI_ENCURLIM_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_ENCURLIM.

VDD_SPI_DCURLIM_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_VDD_SPI_DCURLIM.

RPT4_RESERVED3_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_RPT4_RESERVED3.

DIS_USB_DOWNLOAD_MODE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_DIS_USB_DOWNLOAD_MODE.

ENABLE_SECURITY_DOWNLOAD_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_ENABLE_SECURITY_DOWNLOAD.

PIN_POWER_SELECTION_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_PIN_POWER_SELECTION.

FLASH_TYPE_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_FLASH_TYPE.

FORCE_SEND_RESUME_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_FORCE_SEND_RESUME.

SECURE_VERSION_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_SECURE_VERSION.

RPT4_RESERVED2_ERR.description: Any bit equal to 1 denotes a programming error in EFUSE_RPT4_RESERVED2.

RPT4_RESERVED4_ERR.description: If any bit in RPT4_RESERVED4 is 1, there is a programming error in EFUSE_RPT4_RESERVED4.

MAC_SPI_8M_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in BLOCK1.

MAC_SPI_8M_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of BLOCK1 is reliable. 1: Means that programming BLOCK1 data failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

SYS_PART1_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in BLOCK2.

SYS_PART1_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of BLOCK2 is reliable. 1: Means that programming BLOCK2 data failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

USR_DATA_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in BLOCK3.

USR_DATA_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of BLOCK3 is reliable. 1: Means that programming BLOCK3 data failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

KEY0_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in KEY0.

KEY0_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY0 is reliable. 1: Means that programming KEY0 failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

KEY1_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in KEY1.

KEY1_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY1 is reliable. 1: Means that programming KEY1 failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

KEY2_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in KEY2.

KEY2_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY2 is reliable. 1: Means that programming KEY2 failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

KEY3_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in KEY3.

KEY3_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY3 is reliable. 1: Means that programming KEY3 failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

KEY4_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in KEY4.

KEY4_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY4 is reliable. 1: Means that programming KEY4 failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

KEY5_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in KEY5.

KEY5_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of KEY5 is reliable. 1: Means that programming user data failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

SYS_PART2_ERR_NUM.description: The value of this signal means the number of error bytes in BLOCK10.

SYS_PART2_FAIL.description: 0: Means no failure and that the data of BLOCK10 is reliable. 1: Means that programming BLOCK10 data failed and the number of error bytes is over 5.

EFUSE_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: If set, forces eFuse SRAM into power-saving mode.

MEM_CLK_FORCE_ON.description: If set, forces to activate clock signal of eFuse SRAM.

EFUSE_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: If set, forces eFuse SRAM into working mode.

EN.description: If set, forces to enable clock signal of eFuse memory.

OP_CODE.description: 0x5A5A: Operate programming command. 0x5AA5: Operate read command.

STATE.description: Indicates the state of the eFuse state machine.

REPEAT_ERR_CNT.description: Indicates the number of error bits during programming BLOCK0.

READ_CMD.description: Set this bit to send read command.

PGM_CMD.description: Set this bit to send programming command.

BLK_NUM.description: The serial number of the block to be programmed. Value 0-10 corresponds to block number 0-10, respectively.

READ_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable signal for pgm_done interrupt.

READ_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear signal for read_done interrupt.

PGM_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear signal for pgm_done interrupt.

DAC_CLK_DIV.description: Controls the division factor of the rising clock of the programming voltage.

DAC_NUM.description: Controls the rising period of the programming voltage.

OE_CLR.description: Reduces the power supply of the programming voltage.

THR_A.description: Configures the hold time of read operation.

TRD.description: Configures the length of pulse of read operation.

TSUR_A.description: Configures the setup time of read operation.

READ_INIT_NUM.description: Configures the initial read time of eFuse.

THP_A.description: Configures the hold time of programming operation.

TPGM_INACTIVE.description: Configures the length of pulse during programming 0 to eFuse.

TPGM.description: Configures the length of pulse during programming 1 to eFuse.

TSUP_A.description: Configures the setup time of programming operation.

PWR_ON_NUM.description: Configures the power up time for VDDQ.

PWR_OFF_NUM.description: Configures the power outage time for VDDQ.

PRO_DCACHE_ENABLE.description: The bit is used to activate the data cache. 0: disable, 1: enable

PRO_DCACHE_SETSIZE_MODE.description: The bit is used to configure cache memory size.0: 8KB, 1: 16KB

PRO_DCACHE_BLOCKSIZE_MODE.description: The bit is used to configure cache block size.0: 16 bytes, 1: 32 bytes

PRO_DCACHE_INVALIDATE_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable invalidate operation. It will be cleared by hardware after invalidate operation done.

PRO_DCACHE_INVALIDATE_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate invalidate operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_FLUSH_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable flush operation. It will be cleared by hardware after flush operation done.

PRO_DCACHE_FLUSH_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate flush operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_CLEAN_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable clean operation. It will be cleared by hardware after clean operation done.

PRO_DCACHE_CLEAN_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate clean operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_EN.description: The bit is used to enable pre-lock operation which is combined with PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_ADDR_REG and PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_SIZE_REG.

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_EN.description: The bit is used to enable pre-lock operation which is combined with PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_ADDR_REG and PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_SIZE_REG.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable and disable conditional-preload operation. It is combined with pre_dcache_autoload_done. 1: enable, 0: disable.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate conditional-preload operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable preload operation. It will be cleared by hardware after preload operation done.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate preload operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_UNLOCK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable unlock operation. It will be cleared by hardware after unlock operation done.

PRO_DCACHE_UNLOCK_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate unlock operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable lock operation. It will be cleared by hardware after lock operation done.

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate lock operation is finished.

PRO_DCACHE_MASK_BUS0.description: The bit is used to disable dbus0, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_DCACHE_MASK_BUS1.description: The bit is used to disable dbus1, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_DCACHE_MASK_BUS2.description: The bit is used to disable dbus2, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_DCACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of dcache tag memory. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

PRO_DCACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power dcache tag memory down, 0: follow  rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power down

PRO_DCACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power dcache tag memory down, 0: follow  rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power up

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the first start virtual address of data locking, which is combined with PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_SIZE_REG

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the first length of data locking, which is combined with PRO_DCACHE_LOCK0_ADDR_REG

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the second start virtual address of data locking, which is combined with PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_SIZE_REG

PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the second length of data locking, which is combined with PRO_DCACHE_LOCK1_ADDR_REG

PRO_DCACHE_MEMSYNC_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for invalidate, flush, clean, lock and unlock operations. The manual operations will be issued if the address is validate. The auto operations will be issued if the address is invalidate. It should be combined with PRO_DCACHE_MEM_SYNC1.

PRO_DCACHE_MEMSYNC_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for invalidate, flush, clean, lock and unlock operations. The manual operations will be issued if it is validate. The auto operations will be issued if it is invalidate. It should be combined with PRO_DCACHE_MEM_SYNC0.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for manual pre-load operation. It should be combined with PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_SIZE_REG.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for manual pre-load operation.  It should be combined with PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_ADDR_REG..

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_ORDER.description: The bits are used to configure the direction of manual pre-load operation. 1: descending, 0: ascending.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_ORDER.description: The bits are used to configure the direction of conditional pre-load operation. 1: descending, 0: ascending.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_RQST.description: The bits are used to configure trigger conditions for conditional pre-load. 0/3: cache miss, 1: cache hit, 2: both cache miss and hit.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the numbers of the cache block for the issuing conditional pre-load operation.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_ENA.description: The bits are used to enable the second section for conditional pre-load operation.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_ENA.description: The bits are used to enable the first section for conditional pre-load operation.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of the first section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_dcache_autoload_sct0_ena.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length of the first section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_dcache_autoload_sct0_ena.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of the second section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_dcache_autoload_sct1_ena.

PRO_DCACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length of the second section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_dcache_autoload_sct1_ena.

PRO_ICACHE_ENABLE.description: The bit is used to activate the data cache. 0: disable, 1: enable

PRO_ICACHE_SETSIZE_MODE.description: The bit is used to configure cache memory size.0: 8KB, 1: 16KB

PRO_ICACHE_BLOCKSIZE_MODE.description: The bit is used to configure cache block size.0: 16 bytes, 1: 32 bytes

PRO_ICACHE_INVALIDATE_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable invalidate operation. It will be cleared by hardware after invalidate operation done.

PRO_ICACHE_INVALIDATE_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate invalidate operation is finished.

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_EN.description: The bit is used to enable pre-lock operation which is combined with PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_ADDR_REG and PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_SIZE_REG.

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_EN.description: The bit is used to enable pre-lock operation which is combined with PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_ADDR_REG and PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_SIZE_REG.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable and disable conditional-preload operation. It is combined with pre_dcache_autoload_done. 1: enable, 0: disable.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate conditional-preload operation is finished.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable preload operation. It will be cleared by hardware after preload operation done.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate preload operation is finished.

PRO_ICACHE_UNLOCK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable unlock operation. It will be cleared by hardware after unlock operation done.

PRO_ICACHE_UNLOCK_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate unlock operation is finished.

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable lock operation. It will be cleared by hardware after lock operation done.

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK_DONE.description: The bit is used to indicate lock operation is finished.

PRO_ICACHE_MASK_BUS0.description: The bit is used to disable ibus0, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_ICACHE_MASK_BUS1.description: The bit is used to disable ibus1, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_ICACHE_MASK_BUS2.description: The bit is used to disable ibus2, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of icache tag memory. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

PRO_ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power icache tag memory down, 0: follow rtc_lslp, 1: power down

PRO_ICACHE_TAG_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power icache tag memory down, 0: follow rtc_lslp, 1: power up

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the first start virtual address of data locking, which is combined with PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_SIZE_REG

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the first length of data locking, which is combined with PRO_ICACHE_LOCK0_ADDR_REG

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the second start virtual address of data locking, which is combined with PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_SIZE_REG

PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the second length of data locking, which is combined with PRO_ICACHE_LOCK1_ADDR_REG

PRO_ICACHE_MEMSYNC_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for invalidate, flush, clean, lock and unlock operations. The manual operations will be issued if the address is validate. The auto operations will be issued if the address is invalidate. It should be combined with PRO_ICACHE_MEM_SYNC1.

PRO_ICACHE_MEMSYNC_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for invalidate, flush, clean, lock and unlock operations. The manual operations will be issued if it is validate. The auto operations will be issued if it is invalidate. It should be combined with PRO_ICACHE_MEM_SYNC0.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address for manual pre-load operation. It should be combined with PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_SIZE_REG.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length for manual pre-load operation.  It should be combined with PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_ADDR_REG..

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_ORDER.description: The bits are used to configure the direction of manual pre-load operation. 1: descending, 0: ascending.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_ORDER.description: The bits are used to configure the direction of conditional pre-load operation. 1: descending, 0: ascending.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_RQST.description: The bits are used to configure trigger conditions for conditional pre-load. 0/3: cache miss, 1: cache hit, 2: both cache miss and hit.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the numbers of the cache block for the issuing conditional pre-load operation.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_ENA.description: The bits are used to enable the second section for conditional pre-load operation.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_ENA.description: The bits are used to enable the first section for conditional pre-load operation.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of the first section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_icache_autoload_sct0_ena.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT0_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length of the first section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_icache_autoload_sct0_ena.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_ADDR.description: The bits are used to configure the start virtual address of the second section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_icache_autoload_sct1_ena.

PRO_ICACHE_AUTOLOAD_SCT1_SIZE.description: The bits are used to configure the length of the second section for conditional pre-load operation. It should be combined with pro_icache_autoload_sct1_ena.

IC_PRELOAD_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of issued pre-load which include manual pre-load and conditional pre-load.

IC_PRELOAD_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of missed pre-load which include manual pre-load and conditional pre-load.

IBUS2_ABANDON_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the abandoned ibus2 access.

IBUS1_ABANDON_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the abandoned ibus1 access.

IBUS0_ABANDON_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the abandoned ibus0 access.

IBUS2_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by ibus2 access.

IBUS1_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by ibus1 access.

IBUS0_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by ibus0 access.

IBUS2_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of ibus2 access icache.

IBUS1_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of ibus1 access icache.

IBUS0_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of ibus0 access icache.

DC_PRELOAD_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of issued pre-load which include manual pre-load and conditional pre-load.

DC_PRELOAD_EVICT_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of cache evictions by pre-load which include manual pre-load and conditional pre-load.

DC_PRELOAD_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of missed pre-load which include manual pre-load and conditional pre-load.

DBUS2_ABANDON_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the abandoned dbus2 access.

DBUS1_ABANDON_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the abandoned dbus1 access.

DBUS0_ABANDON_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the abandoned dbus0 access.

DBUS2_ACS_WB_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of cache evictions by dbus2 access cache.

DBUS1_ACS_WB_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of cache evictions by dbus1 access cache.

DBUS0_ACS_WB_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of cache evictions by dbus0 access cache.

DBUS2_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by dbus2 access.

DBUS1_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by dbus1 access.

DBUS0_ACS_MISS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of the cache miss caused by dbus0 access.

DBUS2_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of dbus2 access dcache.

DBUS1_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of dbus1 access dcache.

DBUS0_ACS_CNT.description: The bits are used to count the number of dbus0 access dcache.

CACHE_DBG_EN.description: The bit is used to activate the cache track function. 1: enable, 0: disable.

IBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding ibus is disabled which include speculative access.

IBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by ibus counter overflow.

IC_SYNC_SIZE_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by manual sync configurations fault.

IC_PRELOAD_SIZE_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by manual pre-load configurations fault.

ICACHE_REJECT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by authentication fail.

ICACHE_SET_PRELOAD_ILG_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by illegal writing preload registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

ICACHE_SET_SYNC_ILG_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by illegal writing sync registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

ICACHE_SET_LOCK_ILG_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by illegal writing lock registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync or pre-load operations.

DBUS_ACS_MSK_DC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by cpu access dcache while the corresponding dbus is disabled which include speculative access.

DBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by dbus counter overflow.

DC_SYNC_SIZE_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by manual sync configurations fault.

DC_PRELOAD_SIZE_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by manual pre-load configurations fault.

DCACHE_WRITE_FLASH_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by dcache trying to write flash.

DCACHE_REJECT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by authentication fail.

DCACHE_SET_PRELOAD_ILG_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by illegal writing preload registers of dcache while dcache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

DCACHE_SET_SYNC_ILG_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by illegal writing sync registers of dcache while dcache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

DCACHE_SET_LOCK_ILG_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by illegal writing lock registers of dcache while dcache is busy to issue lock,sync or pre-load operations.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS_ACS_MSK_IC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by cpu access icache while the corresponding ibus is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

IBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by ibus counter overflow.

IC_SYNC_SIZE_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by manual sync configurations fault.

IC_PRELOAD_SIZE_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by manual pre-load configurations fault.

ICACHE_REJECT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by authentication fail.

ICACHE_SET_ILG_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by illegal writing lock registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync or pre-load operations.

DBUS_ACS_MSK_DC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by cpu access dcache while the corresponding dbus is disabled or dcache is disabled which include speculative access.

DBUS_CNT_OVF_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by dbus counter overflow.

DC_SYNC_SIZE_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by manual sync configurations fault.

DC_PRELOAD_SIZE_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by manual pre-load configurations fault.

DCACHE_WRITE_FLASH_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by dcache trying to write flash.

DCACHE_REJECT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by authentication fail.

DCACHE_SET_ILG_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by illegal writing lock registers of dcache while dcache is busy to issue lock,sync or pre-load operations.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear interrupt by mmu entry fault.

IBUS0_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access icache while the ibus0 is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

IBUS1_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access icache while the ibus1 is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

IBUS2_ACS_MSK_ICACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access icache while the ibus2 is disabled or icache is disabled which include speculative access.

IBUS0_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus0 counter overflow.

IBUS1_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus1 counter overflow.

IBUS2_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus2 counter overflow.

IBUS0_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus0 miss counter overflow.

IBUS1_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus1 miss counter overflow.

IBUS2_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus2 miss counter overflow.

IBUS0_ABANDON_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus0 abandon counter overflow.

IBUS1_ABANDON_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus1 abandon counter overflow.

IBUS2_ABANDON_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by ibus2 abandon counter overflow.

IC_PRELOAD_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by pre-load miss counter overflow.

IC_PRELOAD_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by pre-load counter overflow.

IC_SYNC_SIZE_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by manual sync configurations fault.

IC_PRELOAD_SIZE_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by manual pre-load configurations fault.

ICACHE_REJECT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by authentication fail.

ICACHE_SET_PRELOAD_ILG_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by illegal writing preload registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

ICACHE_SET_SYNC_ILG_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by illegal writing sync registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

ICACHE_SET_LOCK_ILG_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by illegal writing lock registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync or pre-load operations.

DBUS0_ACS_MSK_DCACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access dcache while the dbus0 is disabled or dcache is disabled which include speculative access.

DBUS1_ACS_MSK_DCACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access dcache while the dbus1 is disabled or dcache is disabled which include speculative access.

DBUS2_ACS_MSK_DCACHE_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by cpu access dcache while the dbus2 is disabled or dcache is disabled which include speculative access.

DBUS0_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus0 counter overflow.

DBUS1_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus1 counter overflow.

DBUS2_ACS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus2 counter overflow.

DBUS0_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus0 miss counter overflow.

DBUS1_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus1 miss counter overflow.

DBUS2_ACS_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus2 miss counter overflow.

DBUS0_ACS_WB_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus0 eviction counter overflow.

DBUS1_ACS_WB_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus1 eviction counter overflow.

DBUS2_ACS_WB_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus2 eviction counter overflow.

DBUS0_ABANDON_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus0 abandon counter overflow.

DBUS1_ABANDON_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus1 abandon counter overflow.

DBUS2_ABANDON_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dbus2 abandon counter overflow.

DC_PRELOAD_MISS_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by pre-load miss counter overflow.

DC_PRELOAD_EVICT_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by pre-load eviction counter overflow.

DC_PRELOAD_CNT_OVF_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by pre-load counter overflow.

DC_SYNC_SIZE_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by manual sync configurations fault.

DC_PRELOAD_SIZE_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by manual pre-load configurations fault.

DCACHE_WRITE_FLASH_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by dcache trying to write flash.

DCACHE_REJECT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by authentication fail.

DCACHE_SET_PRELOAD_ILG_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by illegal writing preload registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

DCACHE_SET_SYNC_ILG_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by illegal writing sync registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync and pre-load operations.

DCACHE_SET_LOCK_ILG_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by illegal writing lock registers of icache while icache is busy to issue lock,sync or pre-load operations.

MMU_ENTRY_FAULT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate interrupt by mmu entry fault.

PRO_DCACHE_ACS_CNT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear dcache counter which include DC_PRELOAD_CNT_REG, DC_PRELOAD_EVICT_CNT_REG, DC_PRELOAD_MISS_CNT_REG, DBUS0-2_ABANDON_CNT_REG, DBUS0-2_ACS_WB_CNT_REG, DBUS0-2_ACS_MISS_CNT_REG and DBUS0-2_ACS_CNT_REG.

PRO_ICACHE_ACS_CNT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear icache counter which include IC_PRELOAD_CNT_REG, IC_PRELOAD_MISS_CNT_REG, IBUS0-2_ABANDON_CNT_REG, IBUS0-2_ACS_MISS_CNT_REG and IBUS0-2_ACS_CNT_REG.

PRO_DCACHE_TAG_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of data from external memory when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able, 4: write-able.

PRO_DCACHE_CPU_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of CPU access dcache when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able, 4: write-able.

PRO_DCACHE_CPU_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address of CPU access dcache when authentication fail.

PRO_ICACHE_TAG_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of data from external memory when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able, 4: write-able.

PRO_ICACHE_CPU_ATTR.description: The bits are used to indicate the attribute of CPU access icache when authentication fail. 0: invalidate, 1: execute-able, 2: read-able

PRO_ICACHE_CPU_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address of CPU access icache when authentication fail.

PRO_CACHE_MMU_FAULT_CONTENT.description: The bits are used to indicate the content of mmu entry which cause mmu fault..

PRO_CACHE_MMU_FAULT_CODE.description: The bits are used to indicate the operations which cause mmu fault occurrence. 0: default, 1: cpu miss, 2: preload miss, 3: flush, 4: cpu miss evict recovery address, 5: load miss evict recovery address, 6: external dma tx, 7: external dma rx

PRO_CACHE_MMU_FAULT_VADDR.description: The bits are used to indicate the virtual address which cause mmu fault..

PRO_CACHE_FLASH_WRAP_AROUND.description: The bit is used to enable wrap around mode when read data from flash.

PRO_CACHE_SRAM_RD_WRAP_AROUND.description: The bit is used to enable wrap around mode when read data from spiram.

PRO_CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_ON.description: The bit is used to enable clock gating to save power when access mmu memory, 0: enable, 1: disable

PRO_CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: The bit is used to power mmu memory down, 0: follow_rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power down

PRO_CACHE_MMU_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: The bit is used to power mmu memory down, 0: follow_rtc_lslp_pd, 1: power up

PRO_ICACHE_STATE.description: The bit is used to indicate icache main fsm is in idle state or not. 1: in idle state,  0: not in idle state

PRO_DCACHE_STATE.description: The bit is used to indicate dcache main fsm is in idle state or not. 1: in idle state,  0: not in idle state

CLK_FORCE_ON_DB_ENCRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of encrypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

CLK_FORCE_ON_G0CB_DECRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of decrypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

CLK_FORCE_ON_AUTOMATIC_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT.description: The bit is used to close clock gating of encrypt and decrypt clock. 1: close gating, 0: open clock gating.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by icache pre-load done.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by icache pre-load done.

PRO_ICACHE_PRELOAD_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by icache pre-load done.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by dcache pre-load done.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by dcache pre-load done.

PRO_DCACHE_PRELOAD_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by dcache pre-load done.

PRO_ICACHE_SYNC_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by icache sync done.

PRO_ICACHE_SYNC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by icache sync done.

PRO_ICACHE_SYNC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by icache sync done.

PRO_DCACHE_SYNC_INT_ST.description: The bit is used to indicate the interrupt by dcache sync done.

PRO_DCACHE_SYNC_INT_ENA.description: The bit is used to enable the interrupt by dcache sync done.

PRO_DCACHE_SYNC_INT_CLR.description: The bit is used to clear the interrupt by dcache sync done.

PRO_CACHE_IGNORE_PRELOAD_MMU_ENTRY_FAULT.description: The bit is used to disable checking mmu entry fault by preload operation.

PRO_CACHE_IGNORE_SYNC_MMU_ENTRY_FAULT.description: The bit is used to disable checking mmu entry fault by sync operation.

SCL_LOW_PERIOD.description: Configures the low level width of the SCL clock

TO.description: Setting time out control for receiving data

INT_STATUS.description: Status of captured I2C communication events

SDA_HOLD.description: Configures the hold time after a negative SCL edge

SDA_SAMPLE.description: Configures the sample time after a positive SCL edge

SCL_HIGH_PERIOD.description: Configures the high level width of the SCL clock

SCL_START_HOLD.description: Configures the interval between pulling SDA low and pulling SCL low when the master generates a START condition

SCL_RSTART_SETUP.description: Configures the interval between the positive edge of SCL and the negative edge of SDA

SCL_STOP_HOLD.description: Configures the delay after the SCL clock edge for a stop condition

SCL_STOP_SETUP.description: Configures the delay between the SDA and SCL positive edge for a stop condition

SCL_MAIN_ST_TIME_OUT.description: SCL main status time out register

SCL_STRETCH_CONF.description: Set SCL stretch of I2C slave

SCL_LOW_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure for how long SCL remains low in master mode, in I2C module clock cycles.

SAMPLE_SCL_LEVEL.description:
This register is used to select the sample mode.

1: sample SDA data on the SCL low level.

0: sample SDA data on the SCL high level.

RX_FULL_ACK_LEVEL.description: This register is used to configure the ACK value that need to sent by master when the rx_fifo_cnt has reached the threshold.

MS_MODE.description: Set this bit to configure the module as an I2C Master. Clear this bit to configure the module as an I2C Slave.

TRANS_START.description: Set this bit to start sending the data in TX FIFO.

TX_LSB_FIRST.description:
This bit is used to control the sending mode for data needing to be sent.

1: send data from the least significant bit.

0: send data from the most significant bit.

RX_LSB_FIRST.description:
This bit is used to control the storage mode for received data.

1: receive data from the least significant bit.

0: receive data from the most significant bit.

ARBITRATION_EN.description: This is the enable bit for I2C bus arbitration function.

FSM_RST.description: This register is used to reset the SCL_FSM.

REF_ALWAYS_ON.description: This register is used to control the REF_TICK.

RESP_REC.description: The received ACK value in master mode or slave mode. 0: ACK. 1: NACK.

SLAVE_RW.description: When in slave mode, 1: master reads from slave. 0: master writes to slave.

TIME_OUT.description: When the I2C controller takes more than I2C_TIME_OUT clocks to receive a data bit, this field changes to 1.

ARB_LOST.description: When the I2C controller loses control of SCL line, this register changes to 1.

BUS_BUSY.description: 1: the I2C bus is busy transferring data. 0: the I2C bus is in idle state.

SLAVE_ADDRESSED.description: When configured as an I2C Slave, and the address sent by the master is equal to the address of the slave, then this bit will be of high level.

BYTE_TRANS.description: This field changes to 1 when one byte is transferred.

RXFIFO_CNT.description: This field represents the amount of data needed to be sent.

STRETCH_CAUSE.description: The cause of stretching SCL low in slave mode. 0:  stretching SCL low at the beginning of I2C read data state. 1: stretching SCL low when I2C TX FIFO is empty in slave mode. 2: stretching SCL low when I2C RX FIFO is full in slave mode.

TXFIFO_CNT.description: This field stores the amount of received data in RAM.

SCL_MAIN_STATE_LAST.description:
This field indicates the states of the I2C module state machine.

0: Idle. 1: Address shift. 2: ACK address. 3: RX data. 4: TX data. 5: Send ACK. 6: Wait ACK

SCL_STATE_LAST.description:
This field indicates the states of the state machine used to produce SCL.

0: Idle. 1: Start. 2: Negative edge. 3: Low. 4: Positive edge. 5: High. 6: Stop

TIME_OUT_VALUE.description: This register is used to configure the timeout for receiving a data bit in APB clock cycles.

TIME_OUT_EN.description: This is the enable bit for time out control.

SLAVE_ADDR.description: When configured as an I2C Slave, this field is used to configure the slave address.

ADDR_10BIT_EN.description: This field is used to enable the slave 10-bit addressing mode in master mode.

RXFIFO_START_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the last received data, as described in I2C_NONFIFO_RX_THRES.

RXFIFO_END_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the last received data, as described in I2C_NONFIFO_RX_THRES. This value refreshes when an I2C_RXFIFO_UDF_INT or I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt is generated.

TXFIFO_START_ADDR.description: This is the offset address of the first sent data, as described in I2C_NONFIFO_TX_THRES.

TXFIFO_END_ADDR.description:
This is the offset address of the last sent data, as described in  I2C_NONFIFO_TX_THRES.

The value refreshes when an I2C_TXFIFO_OVF_INT or I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt is generated.

RX_UPDATE.description: Write 0 or 1 to I2C_RX_UPDATE to update the value of I2C_RXFIFO_END_ADDR and I2C_RXFIFO_START_ADDR.

TX_UPDATE.description: Write 0 or 1 to I2C_TX_UPDATE to update the value of I2C_TXFIFO_END_ADDR and I2C_TXFIFO_START_ADDR.

SLAVE_RW_POINT.description: The received data in I2C slave mode.

RXFIFO_WM_THRHD.description: The water mark threshold of RX FIFO in non-FIFO mode. When I2C_FIFO_PRT_EN is 1 and RX FIFO counter is bigger than I2C_RXFIFO_WM_THRHD[4:0], I2C_RXFIFO_WM_INT_RAW bit will be valid.

TXFIFO_WM_THRHD.description: The water mark threshold of TX FIFO in non-FIFO mode. When I2C_FIFO_PRT_EN is 1 and TX FIFO counter is smaller than I2C_TXFIFO_WM_THRHD[4:0], I2C_TXFIFO_WM_INT_RAW bit will be valid.

NONFIFO_EN.description: Set this bit to enable APB non-FIFO mode.

FIFO_ADDR_CFG_EN.description: When this bit is set to 1, the byte received after the I2C address byte represents the offset address in the I2C Slave RAM.

RX_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset RX FIFO.

TX_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset TX FIFO.

NONFIFO_RX_THRES.description: When I2C receives more than I2C_NONFIFO_RX_THRES bytes of data, it will generate an I2C_RXFIFO_UDF_INT interrupt and update the current offset address of the received data.

NONFIFO_TX_THRES.description: When I2C sends more than I2C_NONFIFO_TX_THRES bytes of data, it will generate an I2C_TXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt and update the current offset address of the sent data.

FIFO_PRT_EN.description: The control enable bit of FIFO pointer in non-FIFO mode. This bit controls the valid bits and the interrupts of TX/RX FIFO overflow, underflow, full and empty.

FIFO_RDATA.description: The value of RX FIFO read data.

RXFIFO_WM_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_WM_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

BYTE_TRANS_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_ARBITRATION_LOST_INT interrupt.

MST_TXFIFO_UDF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_TIME_OUT_INT interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_TRANS_START_INT interrupt.

NACK_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_UDF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_UDF_INT  interrupt.

SCL_ST_TO_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SCL_ST_TO_INT interrupt.

SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_INT interrupt.

DET_START_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_DET_START_INT interrupt.

SLAVE_STRETCH_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_WM_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_RXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_WM_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_TXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_RXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

BYTE_TRANS_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C_ARBITRATION_LOST_INT interrupt.

MST_TXFIFO_UDF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C_TIME_OUT_INT interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C_TRANS_START_INT interrupt.

NACK_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_TXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_UDF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_RXFIFO_UDF_INT  interrupt.

SCL_ST_TO_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_SCL_ST_TO_INT interrupt.

SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_INT interrupt.

DET_START_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_DET_START_INT interrupt.

SLAVE_STRETCH_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_WM_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_WM_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

BYTE_TRANS_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_ARBITRATION_LOST_INT interrupt.

MST_TXFIFO_UDF_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TIME_OUT_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_TIME_OUT_INT interrupt.

TRANS_START_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for the I2C_TRANS_START_INT interrupt.

NACK_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_OVF_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_TXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_UDF_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_RXFIFO_UDF_INT  interrupt.

SCL_ST_TO_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SCL_ST_TO_INT interrupt.

SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SCL_MAIN_ST_TO_INT interrupt.

DET_START_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_DET_START_INT interrupt.

SLAVE_STRETCH_INT_ENA.description: The raw interrupt bit for I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_WM_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for I2C_RXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_WM_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for I2C_TXFIFO_WM_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for I2C_RXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

END_DETECT_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

BYTE_TRANS_DONE_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the I2C_END_DETECT_INT interrupt.

ARBITRATION_LOST_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the I2C_ARBITRATION_LOST_INT interrupt.

MST_TXFIFO_UDF_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.

TRANS_COMPLETE_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the I2C_TRANS_COMPLETE_INT interrupt.
