SLAVE_STRETCH_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit for I2C_SLAVE_STRETCH_INT interrupt.

TIME.description: This register is used to configure the interval between changing the SDA output level and the falling edge of SCL, in I2C module clock cycles.
This register is used to configure the interval between the rising edge of SCL and the level sampling time of SDA, in I2C module clock cycles.

SCL_HIGH_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure for how long SCL remains high in master mode, in I2C module clock cycles.

SCL_WAIT_HIGH_PERIOD.description: This register is used to configure for the SCL_FSM's waiting period for SCL to go high in master mode, in I2C module clock cycles.

TIME.description: This register is used to configure  interval between pulling SDA low and pulling SCL low when the master generates a START condition, in I2C module clock cycles.
This register is used to configure the interval between the positive edge of SCL and the negative edge of SDA for a RESTART condition, in I2C module clock cycles.
This register is used to configure the delay after the STOP condition, in I2C module clock cycles.
This register is used to configure the time between the positive edge of SCL and the positive edge of SDA, in I2C module clock cycles.

SCL_FILTER_THRES.description: When a pulse on the SCL input has smaller width than this register value in I2C module clock cycles, the I2C controller will ignore that pulse.

SCL_FILTER_EN.description: This is the filter enable bit for SCL.

SDA_FILTER_THRES.description: When a pulse on the SDA input has smaller width than this register value in I2C module clock cycles, the I2C controller will ignore that pulse.

SDA_FILTER_EN.description: This is the filter enable bit for SDA.

COMMAND.description:
This is the content of command 0. It consists of three parts:

op_code is the command, 0: RSTART. 1: WRITE. 2: READ. 3: STOP. 4: END.

byte_num represents the number of bytes that need to be sent or received.

ack_check_en, ack_exp and ack are used to control the ACK bit. See I2C cmd structure for more information.

COMMAND_DONE.description: When command 0 is done in I2C Master mode, this bit changes to high level.

SCL_ST_TO.description: The threshold value of SCL_FSM state unchanged period.

SCL_MAIN_ST_TO.description: The threshold value of SCL_MAIN_FSM state unchanged period.

SCL_RST_SLV_EN.description: When I2C master is IDLE, set this bit to send out SCL pulses. The number of pulses equals to I2C_SCL_RST_SLV_NUM[4:0].

SCL_RST_SLV_NUM.description: Configure the pulses of SCL generated in I2C master mode. Valid when I2C_SCL_RST_SLV_EN is 1.

SCL_PD_EN.description: The power down enable bit for the I2C output SCL line. 1: Power down. 0: Not power down. Set I2C_SCL_FORCE_OUT and I2C_SCL_PD_EN to 1 to stretch SCL low.

SDA_PD_EN.description: The power down enable bit for the I2C output SDA line. 1: Power down. 0: Not power down. Set I2C_SDA_FORCE_OUT and I2C_SDA_PD_EN to 1 to stretch SDA low.

STRETCH_PROTECT_NUM.description: Configure the period of I2C slave stretching SCL line.

SLAVE_SCL_STRETCH_EN.description: The enable bit for slave SCL stretch function. 1: Enable. 0: Disable. The SCL output line will be stretched low when I2C_SLAVE_SCL_STRETCH_EN is 1 and stretch event happens. The stretch cause can be seen in I2C_STRETCH_CAUSE.

SLAVE_SCL_STRETCH_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear the I2C slave SCL stretch function.

DATE.description: This is the the version control register.

RXEOF_NUM.description: I2S DMA RX EOF data length

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: Address of outlink descriptor that produces EOF

IN_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: Address of inlink descriptor that produces EOF

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: Address of buffer relative to the outlink descriptor that produces EOF

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: Address of next inlink data buffer

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: Address of next outlink data buffer

TX_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset transmitter.

RX_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset receiver.

TX_FIFO_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset TX FIFO.

RX_FIFO_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset RX FIFO.

TX_START.description: Set this bit to start transmitting data.

RX_START.description: Set this bit to start receiving data.

TX_SLAVE_MOD.description: Set this bit to enable slave transmitter mode.

RX_SLAVE_MOD.description: Set this bit to enable slave receiver mode.

TX_RIGHT_FIRST.description: Set this bit to transmit right channel data first.

RX_RIGHT_FIRST.description: Set this bit to receive right channel data first.

TX_MSB_SHIFT.description: Set this bit to enable transmitter in Phillips standard mode.

RX_MSB_SHIFT.description: Set this bit to enable receiver in Phillips standard mode.

TX_SHORT_SYNC.description: Set this bit to enable transmitter in PCM standard mode.

RX_SHORT_SYNC.description: Set this bit to enable receiver in PCM standard mode.

TX_MONO.description: Set this bit to enable transmitter in mono mode.

RX_MONO.description: Set this bit to enable receiver  in mono mode.

TX_MSB_RIGHT.description: Set this bit to place right channel data at the MSB in TX FIFO.

RX_MSB_RIGHT.description: Set this bit to place right channel data at the MSB in RX FIFO.

TX_LSB_FIRST_DMA.description: 1:the data in DMA/APB transform from low bits. 0:the data from DMA/APB transform from high bits.

RX_LSB_FIRST_DMA.description: 1:the data in DMA/APB transform from low bits. 0:the data from DMA/APB transform from high bits.

SIG_LOOPBACK.description: Enable signal loopback mode with transmitter module and receiver module sharing the same WS and BCK signals.

TX_FIFO_RESET_ST.description: I2S TX FIFO reset status. 1: I2S_TX_FIFO_RESET is not completed. 0: I2S_TX_FIFO_RESET is completed.

RX_FIFO_RESET_ST.description: I2S RX FIFO reset status. 1: I2S_RX_FIFO_RESET is not completed. 0: I2S_RX_FIFO_RESET is completed.

TX_RESET_ST.description: I2S TX reset status. 1: I2S_TX_RESET is not completed. 0: I2S_TX_RESET is completed.

TX_DMA_EQUAL.description: 1: Data in left channel is equal to data in right channel. 0: Data in left channel is not equal to data in right channel.

RX_DMA_EQUAL.description: 1: Data in left channel is equal to data in right channel. 0: Data in left channel is not equal to data in right channel.

PRE_REQ_EN.description: Set this bit to enable I2S to prepare data earlier.

RX_RESET_ST.description: I2S RX reset status. 1: I2S_RX_RESET is not completed. 0: I2S_RX_RESET is completed.

RX_TAKE_DATA_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_RX_TAKE_DATA_INT interrupt.

TX_PUT_DATA_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_TX_PUT_DATA_INT interrupt.

RX_WFULL_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_RX_WFULL_INT interrupt.

RX_REMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_RX_REMPTY_INT interrupt.

TX_REMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_TX_REMPTY_INT interrupt.

TX_HUNG_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_TX_HUNG_INT interrupt.

IN_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_IN_DONE_INT interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_IN_SUC_EOF_INT interrupt.

OUT_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_OUT_DONE_INT interrupt.

OUT_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_OUT_EOF_INT interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT interrupt.

V_SYNC_INT_RAW.description: The raw interrupt status bit  for I2S_V_SYNC_INT interrupt.

TX_PUT_DATA_INT_ST.description: The masked interrupt status bit  for I2S_TX_PUT_DATA_INT interrupt.

TX_PUT_DATA_INT_ENA.description: The interrupt enable bit  for I2S_TX_PUT_DATA_INT interrupt.

TAKE_DATA_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2S_RX_TAKE_DATA_INT interrupt.

PUT_DATA_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2S_TX_PUT_DATA_INT interrupt.

RX_WFULL_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2S_RX_WFULL_INT interrupt.

RX_REMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2S_RX_REMPTY_INT interrupt.

TX_WFULL_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2S_TX_WFULL_INT interrupt.

TX_REMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear I2S_TX_REMPTY_INT interrupt.

TX_BCK_IN_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for BCK signal into the transmitter based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 1.5 cycles. 1: delayed by 2.5 cycles. 2: delayed by 3.5 cycles. 3: delayed by 4.5 cycles.

TX_WS_IN_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for WS signal into the transmitter based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 1.5 cycles. 1: delayed by 2.5 cycles. 2: delayed by 3.5 cycles. 3: delayed by 4.5 cycles.

RX_BCK_IN_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for BCK signal into the receiver based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 1.5 cycles. 1: delayed by 2.5 cycles. 2: delayed by 3.5 cycles. 3: delayed by 4.5 cycles.

RX_WS_IN_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for WS signal into the receiver based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 1.5 cycles. 1: delayed by 2.5 cycles. 2: delayed by 3.5 cycles. 3: delayed by 4.5 cycles.

RX_SD_IN_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for SD signal into the receiver based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 1.5 cycles. 1: delayed by 2.5 cycles. 2: delayed by 3.5 cycles. 3: delayed by 4.5 cycles.

TX_BCK_OUT_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for BCK signal out of the transmitter based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 0 cycle. 1: delayed by 1 cycle. 2: delayed by 2 cycles. 3: delayed by 3 cycles.

TX_WS_OUT_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for WS signal out of the transmitter based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 0 cycle. 1: delayed by 1 cycle. 2: delayed by 2 cycles. 3: delayed by 3 cycles.

TX_SD_OUT_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for SD signal out of the transmitter based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 0 cycle. 1: delayed by 1 cycle. 2: delayed by 2 cycles. 3: delayed by 3 cycles.

RX_WS_OUT_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for WS signal out of the receiver based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 0 cycle. 1: delayed by 1 cycle. 2: delayed by 2 cycles. 3: delayed by 3 cycles.

RX_BCK_OUT_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for BCK signal out of the receiver based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 0 cycle. 1: delayed by 1 cycle. 2: delayed by 2 cycles. 3: delayed by 3 cycles.

TX_DSYNC_SW.description: Set this bit to synchronize signals into the transmitter by two flip-flop synchronizer. 0: the signals will be firstly clocked by rising clock edge , then clocked by falling clock edge. 1: the signals will be firstly clocked by falling clock edge, then clocked by rising clock edge.

RX_DSYNC_SW.description: Set this bit to synchronize signals into the receiver by two flip-flop synchronizer. 0: the signals will be clocked by rising clock edge firstly, then clocked by falling clock edge. 1: the signals will be clocked by falling clock edge firstly, then clocked by rising clock edge.

DATA_ENABLE_DELAY.description: Number of delay cycles for data valid flag based on I2S0_CLK. 0: delayed by 1.5 cycles. 1: delayed by 2.5 cycles. 2: delayed by 3.5 cycles. 3: delayed by 4.5 cycles.

TX_BCK_IN_INV.description: Set this bit to invert BCK signal input to the slave transmitter.

RX_DATA_NUM.description: I2S_RX_TAKE_DATA_INT is triggered when the left and right channel data number in RX FIFO is larger than the value of I2S_RX_DATA_NUM[5:0]. (RX FIFO is almost full threshold.)

TX_DATA_NUM.description: I2S_TX_PUT_DATA_INT is triggered when the left and right channel data number in TX FIFO is smaller than the value of I2S_TX_DATA_NUM[5:0]. (TX FIFO is almost empty threshold.)

DSCR_EN.description: Set this bit to enable I2S DMA mode.

TX_FIFO_MOD_FORCE_EN.description: The bit should always be set to 1

RX_FIFO_MOD_FORCE_EN.description: The bit should always be set to 1

RX_FIFO_SYNC.description: force write back rx data to memory

RX_24MSB_EN.description: Only useful in rx 24bit mode. 1: the high 24 bits are effective in i2s fifo   0: the low 24 bits are effective in i2s fifo

TX_24MSB_EN.description: Only useful in tx 24bit mode. 1: the high 24 bits are effective in i2s fifo   0: the low 24 bits are effective in i2s fifo

RX_EOF_NUM.description: The length of data to be received. It will trigger I2S_IN_SUC_EOF_INT.

SIGLE_DATA.description: The right channel or left channel transmits constant value stored in this register according to I2S_TX_CHAN_MOD and I2S_TX_MSB_RIGHT.

TX_CHAN_MOD.description: I2S transmitter channel mode configuration bits.

RX_CHAN_MOD.description: I2S receiver channel mode configuration bits.

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: The address of first outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart outlink descriptor.

INLINK_ADDR.description: The address of first inlink descriptor.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop inlink descriptor.

INLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start inlink descriptor.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart inlink descriptor.

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The address of outlink descriptor that produces EOF.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The address of inlink descriptor that produces EOF.

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: The address of buffer relative to the outlink descriptor that produces EOF.

INLINK_DSCR.description: The address of current inlink descriptor.

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of next inlink descriptor.

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of next inlink data buffer.

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The address of current outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The address of next outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The address of next outlink data buffer.

IN_RST.description: Set this bit to reset in-DMA FSM. Set this bit before the DMA configuration.

OUT_RST.description: Set this bit to reset out-DMA FSM. Set this bit before the DMA configuration.

AHBM_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset AHB interface cmdFIFO of DMA. Set this bit before the DMA configuration.

AHBM_RST.description: Set this bit to reset AHB interface of DMA. Set this bit before the DMA configuration.

OUT_LOOP_TEST.description: Set this bit to loop test inlink.

IN_LOOP_TEST.description: Set this bit to loop test outlink.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: Set this bit to enable outlink-written-back automatically when out buffer is transmitted done.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: DMA out EOF flag generation mode. 1: When DMA has popped all data from the FIFO. 0: When AHB has pushed all data to the FIFO.

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: DMA outlink descriptor transfer mode configuration bit. 1: Prepare outlink descriptor with burst mode. 0: Prepare outlink descriptor with byte mode.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: DMA inlink descriptor transfer mode configuration bit. 1: Prepare inlink descriptor with burst mode. 0: Prepare inlink descriptor with byte mode.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: Transmitter data transfer mode configuration bit. 1: Prepare out data with burst mode. 0: Prepare out data with byte mode.

CHECK_OWNER.description: Set this bit to enable check owner bit by hardware.

EXT_MEM_BK_SIZE.description: DMA access external memory block size. 0: 16 bytes. 1: 32 bytes. 2: 64 bytes. 3: reserved.

OUTFIFO_CNT.description: The remains of I2S DMA outfifo data.

INFIFO_CNT_DEBUG.description: The remains of I2S DMA infifo data.

LC_FIFO_TIMEOUT.description: I2S_TX_HUNG_INT interrupt or I2S_RX_HUNG_INT interrupt will be triggered when FIFO hung counter is equal to this value.

LC_FIFO_TIMEOUT_SHIFT.description: The bits are used to set the tick counter threshold. The tick counter is clocked by APB_CLK. The tick counter threshold is 88000/2^I2S_LC_FIFO_TIMEOUT_SHIFT. The tick counter is reset when it reaches the threshold.

LC_FIFO_TIMEOUT_ENA.description: The enable bit for FIFO timeout.

TX_PCM_CONF.description: Compress/Decompress module configuration bits. 0: decompress transmitted data  1:compress transmitted data

TX_PCM_BYPASS.description: Set this bit to bypass  Compress/Decompress module for transmitted data.

RX_PCM_CONF.description: Compress/Decompress module configuration bits. 0: decompress received data  1:compress received data

RX_PCM_BYPASS.description: Set this bit to bypass Compress/Decompress module for received data.

TX_STOP_EN.description: Set this bit to stop the output of BCK signal and WS signal when TX FIFO is empty.

DMA_RAM_CLK_FO.description: Set this bit to force on DMA RAM clock.

CAMERA_EN.description: Set this bit to enable camera mode.

LCD_TX_WRX2_EN.description: LCD WR double for one datum.

LCD_TX_SDX2_EN.description: Set this bit to duplicate data pairs (Frame Form 2) in LCD mode.

LCD_EN.description: Set this bit to enable LCD mode.

EXT_ADC_START_EN.description: Set this bit to enable the function that ADC mode is triggered by external signal.

INTER_VALID_EN.description: Set this bit to enable camera VGA reducing-resolution mode: only receive two consecutive cycle data in four consecutive clocks.

CAM_SYNC_FIFO_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset FIFO in camera mode.

CAM_CLK_LOOPBACK.description: Set this bit to loopback PCLK from I2S0I_WS_out.

VSYNC_FILTER_EN.description: Set this bit to enable I2S VSYNC filter function.

VSYNC_FILTER_THRES.description: Configure the I2S VSYNC filter threshold value.

CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock gate.

CLK_SEL.description: Set this bit to select I2S module clock source. 0: No clock. 1: APLL_CLK. 2: PLL_160M_CLK. 3: No clock.

TX_BCK_DIV_NUM.description: Bit clock configuration bits in transmitter mode.

RX_BCK_DIV_NUM.description: Bit clock configuration bits in receiver mode.

TX_BITS_MOD.description: Set the bits to configure bit length of I2S transmitter channel, the value of which can only be 8, 16, 24 and 32.

RX_BITS_MOD.description: Set the bits to configure bit length of I2S receiver channel, the value of which can only be 8, 16, 24 and 32.

TX_IDLE.description: 1: I2S TX is in idle state. 0: I2S TX is at work.

CLK_EN.description: This bit is used to enable or disable the clock of interrupt matrix. 1: enable the clock. 0: disable the clock.

PRO_NMI_MASK_HW.description: This bit is used to disable all NMI interrupt signals to CPU.

PIN_CLK_OUT1.description: Configure I2S0 clock output. 0: output I2S0 clock to CLK_OUT1. 15: disabled.

PIN_CLK_OUT2.description: Configure I2S0 clock output. 0: output I2S0 clock to CLK_OUT2. 15: disabled.

PIN_CLK_OUT3.description: Configure I2S0 clock output. 0: output I2S0 clock to CLK_OUT3. 15: disabled.

SWITCH_PRT_NUM.description: IO pin power switch delay, delay unit is one APB clock.

PAD_POWER_CTRL.description: Select power voltage for GPIO33 ~ GPIO37. 1: select VDD_SPI 1.8 V. 0: select VDD3P3_CPU 3.3 V.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable of the pin. 1: Input enabled. 0: Input disabled.

FUN_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pin. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

MCU_SEL.description: Select IO MUX function for this signal. 0: Select Function 1. 1: Select Function 2, etc.

FILTER_EN.description: Enable filter for pin input signals. 1: Filter enabled. 2: Filter disabled.

TIMER_SEL.description:
This field is used to select one of timers for channel %s.

0: select timer 0.

1: select timer 1.

2: select timer 2.

3: select timer 3.

SIG_OUT_EN.description: Set this bit to enable signal output on channel %s.

IDLE_LV.description: This bit is used to control the output value when channel %s is inactive.

PARA_UP.description: This bit is used to update register LEDC_CH%s_HPOINT and LEDC_CH%s_DUTY for channel %s.

OVF_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the maximum times of overflow minus 1. The LEDC_OVF_CNT_CH%s_INT interrupt will be triggered when channel %s overflows for (LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH%s + 1) times.

OVF_CNT_EN.description: This bit is used to enable the ovf_cnt of channel %s.

OVF_CNT_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset the ovf_cnt of channel %s.

OVF_CNT_RESET_ST.description: This is the status bit of LEDC_OVF_CNT_RESET_CH%s.

HPOINT.description: The output value changes to high when the selected timers has reached the value specified by this register.

DUTY.description: This register is used to change the output duty by controlling the Lpoint. The output value turns to low when the selected timers has reached the Lpoint.

DUTY_SCALE.description: This register is used to configure the changing step scale of duty on channel %s.

DUTY_CYCLE.description: The duty will change every LEDC_DUTY_CYCLE_CH%s on channel %s.

DUTY_NUM.description: This register is used to control the number of times the duty cycle will be changed.

DUTY_INC.description: This register is used to increase or decrease the duty of output signal on channel %s. 1: Increase. 0: Decrease.

DUTY_START.description: Other configured fields in LEDC_CH%s_CONF1_REG will start to take effect when this bit is set to 1.

DUTY_R.description: This register stores the current duty of output signal on channel %s.

DUTY_RES.description: This register is used to control the range of the counter in timer %s.

CLK_DIV.description: This register is used to configure the divisor for the divider in timer %s. The least significant eight bits represent the fractional part.

PAUSE.description: This bit is used to suspend the counter in timer %s.

RST.description: This bit is used to reset timer %s. The counter will show 0 after reset.

TICK_SEL.description: This bit is used to select clock for timer %s. When this bit is set to 1 LEDC_APB_CLK_SEL[1:0] should be 1, otherwise the timer clock may be not accurate. 0: LEDC_PWM_CLK. 1: REF_TICK.

PARA_UP.description: Set this bit to update LEDC_CLK_DIV_TIMER%s and LEDC_TIMER%s_DUTY_RES.

CNT.description: This register stores the current counter value of timer %s.

TIMER0_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer0 has reached its maximum counter value.

TIMER1_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer1 has reached its maximum counter value.

TIMER2_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer2 has reached its maximum counter value.

TIMER3_OVF_INT_RAW.description: Triggered when the timer3 has reached its maximum counter value.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH0_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 0. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH1_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 1. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

DUTY_CHNG_END_CH7_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 7. Triggered when the gradual change of duty has finished.

OVF_CNT_CH0_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 0. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH0.

OVF_CNT_CH1_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 1. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH1.

OVF_CNT_CH7_INT_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit for channel 7. Triggered when the ovf_cnt has reached the value specified by LEDC_OVF_NUM_CH7.

APB_CLK_SEL.description: This bit is used to select clock source for the 4 timers . 1: APB_CLK. 2: RTC8M_CLK. 3: XTAL_CLK.

CLK_EN.description: This bit is used to control clock. 1: Force clock on for register. 0: Support clock only when application writes registers.

DATE.description: This is the version control register.

FILTER_THRES.description:
This sets the maximum threshold, in APB_CLK cycles, for the filter.
Any pulses with width less than this will be ignored when the filter is enabled.

FILTER_EN.description: This is the enable bit for unit %s's input filter.

THR_ZERO_EN.description: This is the enable bit for unit %s's zero comparator.

THR_H_LIM_EN.description: This is the enable bit for unit %s's thr_h_lim comparator.

THR_L_LIM_EN.description: This is the enable bit for unit %s's thr_l_lim comparator.

THR_THRES0_EN.description: This is the enable bit for unit %s's thres0 comparator.

THR_THRES1_EN.description: This is the enable bit for unit %s's thres1 comparator.

CH0_NEG_MODE.description:
This register sets the behavior when the signal input of channel 0 detects a negative edge.
1: Increase the counter. 2: Decrease the counter. 0, 3: No effect on counter.

CH0_POS_MODE.description:
This register sets the behavior when the signal input of channel 0 detects a positive edge.
1: Increase the counter. 2: Decrease the counter. 0, 3: No effect on counter.

CH0_HCTRL_MODE.description:
This register configures how the CH%s_POS_MODE/CH%s_NEG_MODE settings will be modified when the control signal is high.
0: No modification. 1: Invert behavior (increase -> decrease, decrease -> increase). 2, 3: Inhibit counter modification.

CH0_LCTRL_MODE.description:
This register configures how the CH%s_POS_MODE/CH%s_NEG_MODE settings will be modified when the control signal is low.
0: No modification. 1: Invert behavior (increase -> decrease, decrease -> increase). 2, 3: Inhibit counter modification.

CH1_NEG_MODE.description:
This register sets the behavior when the signal input of channel 1 detects a negative edge.
1: Increment the counter. 2: Decrement the counter. 0, 3: No effect on counter.

CH1_POS_MODE.description:
This register sets the behavior when the signal input of channel 1 detects a positive edge.
1: Increment the counter. 2: Decrement the counter. 0, 3: No effect on counter.

CH1_HCTRL_MODE.description:
This register configures how the CH%s_POS_MODE/CH%s_NEG_MODE settings will be modified when the control signal is high.
0: No modification. 1: Invert behavior (increase -> decrease, decrease -> increase). 2, 3: Inhibit counter modification.

CH1_LCTRL_MODE.description:
This register configures how the CH%s_POS_MODE/CH%s_NEG_MODE settings will be modified when the control signal is low.
0: No modification. 1: Invert behavior (increase -> decrease, decrease -> increase). 2, 3: Inhibit counter modification.

CNT_THRES0.description: This register is used to configure the thres0 value for unit %s.

CNT_THRES1.description: This register is used to configure the thres1 value for unit %s.

CNT_H_LIM.description: This register is used to configure the thr_h_lim value for unit %s.

CNT_L_LIM.description: This register is used to configure the thr_l_lim value for unit %s.

CNT.description: This register stores the current pulse count value for unit %s.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U0.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U0_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U1.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U1_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U2.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U2_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U3.description: The raw interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U3_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U0.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U0_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U1.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U1_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U2.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U2_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U3.description: The masked interrupt status bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U3_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U1.description: The interrupt enable bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U1_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U3.description: The interrupt enable bit for the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U3_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U0.description: Set this bit to clear the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U0_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U1.description: Set this bit to clear the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U1_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U2.description: Set this bit to clear the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U2_INT interrupt.

CNT_THR_EVENT_U3.description: Set this bit to clear the PCNT_CNT_THR_EVENT_U3_INT interrupt.

ZERO_MODE.description: The pulse counter status of PCNT_U%s corresponding to 0. 0: pulse counter decreases from positive to 0. 1: pulse counter increases from negative to 0. 2: pulse counter is negative. 3: pulse counter is positive.

THRES1.description: The latched value of thres1 event of PCNT_U%s when threshold event interrupt is valid. 1: the current pulse counter equals to thres1 and thres1 event is valid. 0: others.

THRES0.description: The latched value of thres0 event of PCNT_U%s when threshold event interrupt is valid. 1: the current pulse counter equals to thres0 and thres0 event is valid. 0: others.

L_LIM.description: The latched value of low limit event of PCNT_U%s when threshold event interrupt is valid. 1: the current pulse counter equals to thr_l_lim and low limit event is valid. 0: others.

H_LIM.description: The latched value of high limit event of PCNT_U%s when threshold event interrupt is valid. 1: the current pulse counter equals to thr_h_lim and high limit event is valid. 0: others.

ZERO.description: The latched value of zero threshold event of PCNT_U%s when threshold event interrupt is valid. 1: the current pulse counter equals to 0 and zero threshold event is valid. 0: others.

CNT_RST_U0.description: Set this bit to clear unit 0's counter.

CNT_PAUSE_U0.description: Set this bit to freeze unit 1's counter.

CNT_RST_U1.description: Set this bit to clear unit 2's counter.

CNT_PAUSE_U1.description: Set this bit to freeze unit 3's counter.

CNT_RST_U2.description: Set this bit to clear unit 4's counter.

CNT_PAUSE_U2.description: Set this bit to freeze unit 5's counter.

CNT_RST_U3.description: Set this bit to clear unit 6's counter.

CNT_PAUSE_U3.description: Set this bit to freeze unit 7's counter.

CLK_EN.description: The registers clock gate enable signal of PCNT module. 1: the registers can be read and written by application. 0: the registers can not be read or written by application

DATE.description: This is the PCNT version control register.

DMA_RX_I_0.description: RX Copy DMA permission control register 0.

DMA_RX_I_1.description: RX Copy DMA permission control register 1.

DMA_RX_I_2.description: RX Copy DMA permission control register 2.

DMA_TX_I_0.description: TX Copy DMA permission control register 0.

DMA_TX_I_1.description: TX Copy DMA permission control register 1.

DMA_TX_I_2.description: TX Copy DMA permission control register 2.

CLOCK_GATE.description: Clock gate register of permission control.

SDIO_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks SDIO permission control registers.

SDIO_DISABLE.description: Setting to 1 disables the SDIO function.

MAC_DUMP_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks MAC dump permission control registers.

PRO_IRAM0_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks IBUS permission control registers.

PRO_IRAM0_SRAM_0_F.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to fetch SRAM Block 0.

PRO_IRAM0_SRAM_0_R.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to read SRAM Block 0.

PRO_IRAM0_SRAM_0_W.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to write SRAM Block 0.

PRO_IRAM0_SRAM_1_F.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to fetch SRAM Block 1.

PRO_IRAM0_RTCFAST_L_W.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to write RTC FAST low address region.

PRO_IRAM0_RTCFAST_H_F.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to fetch RTC FAST high address region.

PRO_IRAM0_RTCFAST_H_R.description: Setting to 1 grants IBUS permission to read RTC FAST high address region.

PRO_IRAM0_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for IBUS access interrupt.

PRO_IRAM0_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of IBUS. [21:2]: store the bits [21:2] of IBUS address. [1]: 1 means data access, 0 means instruction access. [0]: 1 means write operation, 0 means read operation.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_0_W.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to write SRAM Block 0.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_1_W.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to write SRAM Block 1.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_2_R.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to read SRAM Block 2.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_2_W.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to write SRAM Block 2.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_3_R.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to read SRAM Block 3.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_3_W.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to write SRAM Block 3.

PRO_DRAM0_SRAM_4_SPLTADDR.description: Configure the split address of SRAM Block 4-21 for DBUS0 access.

PRO_DRAM0_RTCFAST_SPLTADDR.description: Configure the split address of RTC FAST for DBUS0 access.

PRO_DRAM0_RTCFAST_L_R.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to read RTC FAST low address region.

PRO_DRAM0_RTCFAST_L_W.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to write RTC FAST low address region.

PRO_DRAM0_RTCFAST_H_R.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to read RTC FAST high address region.

PRO_DRAM0_RTCFAST_H_W.description: Setting to 1 grants DBUS0 permission to write RTC FAST high address region.

PRO_DRAM0_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for DBUS0 access interrupt.

PRO_DRAM0_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for DBUS0 access interrupt.

PRO_DRAM0_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of DBUS. [25:6]: store the bits [21:2] of DBUS address. [5]: 1 means atomic access, 0 means nonatomic access. [4]: 1 means write operation, 0 means read operation. [3:0]: DBUS0 bus byte enables.

PRO_DPORT_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks PeriBus1 permission control registers.

PRO_DPORT_APB_PERIPHERAL_FORBID.description: Setting to 1 denies PeriBus1 bus???s access to APB peripheral.

PRO_DPORT_RTCSLOW_SPLTADDR.description: Configure the split address of RTC FAST for PeriBus1 access.

PRO_DPORT_RTCSLOW_L_W.description: Setting to 1 grants PeriBus1 permission to write RTC FAST low address region.

PRO_DPORT_RTCSLOW_H_R.description: Setting to 1 grants PeriBus1 permission to read RTC FAST high address region.

PRO_DPORT_RTCSLOW_H_W.description: Setting to 1 grants PeriBus1 permission to write RTC FAST high address region.

PRO_DPORT_RESERVE_FIFO_VALID.description: Configure whether to enable read protection for user-configured FIFO address.

PRO_DPORT_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for PeriBus1 access interrupt.

PRO_DPORT_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for PeriBus1 access interrupt.

PRO_DPORT_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of PeriBus1. [25:6]: store the bits [21:2] of PeriBus1 address. [5]: 1 means atomic access, 0 means nonatomic access. [4]: if bits [31:22] of PeriBus1 address are 0xfd, then the bit value is 1, otherwise it is 0. [3:0]: PeriBus1 byte enables.

PRO_AHB_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks PeriBus2 permission control registers.

PRO_AHB_RTCSLOW_0_SPLTADDR.description: Configure the split address of RTCSlow_0 for PeriBus2 access.

PRO_AHB_RTCSLOW_1_H_W.description: Setting to 1 grants PeriBus2 permission to write RTCSlow_1 high address region.

PRO_AHB_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for PeriBus2 access interrupt.

PRO_AHB_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for PeriBus2 access interrupt.

PRO_AHB_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of PeriBus2. [31:2]: store the bits [31:2] of PeriBus2 address. [1]: 1 means data access, 0 means instruction access. [0]: 1 means write operation, 0 means read operation.

PRO_TRACE_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks trace function permission control registers.

PRO_TRACE_DISABLE.description: Setting to 1 disables the trace memory function.

PRO_CACHE_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks cache permission control registers.

PRO_CACHE_CONNECT.description: Configure which SRAM Block will be occupied by Icache or Dcache.

PRO_CACHE_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for cache access interrupt.

PRO_CACHE_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for cache access interrupt.

PRO_CACHE_ILG_ST_I.description: Record the illegitimate information of ICache to access memory. [16]: access enable, active low. [15:4]: store the bits [11:0] of address. [3:0]: Icache bus write byte enables, active low.

PRO_CACHE_ILG_ST_D.description: Record the illegitimate information of Dcache to access memory. [16]: access enable, active low. [15:4]: store the bits [11:0] of address. [3:0]: Dcache bus write byte enables, active low.

DMA_APB_I_SRAM_3_W.description: Setting to 1 grants internal DMA permission to write SRAM Block 3.

DMA_APB_I_SRAM_4_H_W.description: Setting to 1 grants internal DMA permission to write SRAM Block 4-21 high address region.

DMA_APB_I_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for internal DMA access interrupt.

DMA_APB_I_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for internal DMA access interrupt.

DMA_APB_I_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of Internal DMA. [22:6]: store the bits [18:2] of address. [5]: if bits [31:19] of address are 0x7ff, then the bit value is 1, otherwise it is 0. [4]: 1 means write operation, 0 means read operation. [3:0]: Internal DMA bus byte enables.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_0_R.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to read SRAM Block 0.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_0_W.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to write SRAM Block 0.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_1_R.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to read SRAM Block 1.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_1_W.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to write SRAM Block 1.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_2_R.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to read SRAM Block 2.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_2_W.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to write SRAM Block 2.

DMA_RX_I_SRAM_4_H_W.description: Setting to 1 grants RX Copy DMA permission to write SRAM Block 4~21 high address region.

DMA_RX_I_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for RX Copy DMA access interrupt.

DMA_RX_I_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for RX Copy DMA access interrupt.

DMA_RX_I_ILG_INTR.description: RX Copy DMA access interrupt signal.

DMA_RX_I_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of RX Copy DMA. [22:6]: store the bits [18:2] of address. [5]: if bits [31:19] of address are 0x7ff, then the bit value is 1, otherwise it is 0. [4]: 1 means write operation, 0 means read operation. [3:0]: RX Copy DMA bus byte enables.

DMA_TX_I_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks TX Copy DMA permission control registers.

DMA_TX_I_SRAM_0_R.description: Setting to 1 grants TX Copy DMA permission to read SRAM Block 0.

DMA_TX_I_SRAM_3_R.description: Setting to 1 grants TX Copy DMA permission to read SRAM Block 3.

DMA_TX_I_SRAM_3_W.description: Setting to 1 grants TX Copy DMA permission to write SRAM Block 3.

DMA_TX_I_SRAM_4_H_R.description: Setting to 1 grants TX Copy DMA permission to read SRAM Block 4-21 high address region.
