DMA_TX_I_ILG_CLR.description: The clear signal for TX Copy DMA access interrupt.

DMA_TX_I_ILG_EN.description: The enable signal for TX Copy DMA access interrupt.

DMA_TX_I_ILG_INTR.description: TX Copy DMA access interrupt signal.

DMA_TX_I_ILG_ST.description: Record the illegitimate information of TX Copy DMA. [22:6]: store the bits [18:2] of address. [5]: if bits [31:19] of address are 0x7ff, then the bit value is 1, otherwise it is 0. [4]: 1 means write operation, 0 means read operation. [3:0]: TX Copy DMA bus byte enables.

PRO_BOOT_LOCATION_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks boot remap permission control registers.

PRO_BOOT_REMAP.description: If set to 1, enable boot remap function.

CACHE_SOURCE_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks cache access permission control registers.

APB_PERIPHERAL_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks TX Copy DMA permission control registers.

APB_PERIPHERAL_SPLIT_BURST.description: Setting to 1 splits the data phase of the last access and the address phase of following access.

OCCUPY_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks occupy permission control registers.

OCCUPY_CACHE.description: Configure whether SRAM Block 0-3 is used as cache memory.

OCCUPY_MAC_DUMP.description: Configure whether SRAM Block 18-21 is used as mac dump.

OCCUPY_PRO_TRACE.description: Configure one block of SRAM Block 4-21 is used as trace memory.

CACHE_TAG_ACCESS_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks cache tag permission control registers.

PRO_I_TAG_RD_ACS.description: Setting to 1 permits read access to Icache tag memory.

PRO_I_TAG_WR_ACS.description: Setting to 1 permits write access to Icache tag memory.

PRO_D_TAG_RD_ACS.description: Setting to 1 permits read access to Dcache tag memory.

PRO_D_TAG_WR_ACS.description: Setting to 1 permits write access to Dcache tag memory.

CACHE_MMU_ACCESS_LOCK.description: Lock register. Setting to 1 locks cache MMU permission control registers.

PRO_MMU_RD_ACS.description: Setting to 1 permits read access to MMU memory.

PRO_MMU_WR_ACS.description: Setting to 1 permits write access to MMU memory.

APB_PERI_BYTE_ERROR_CLR.description: The clear signal for APB peripheral interrupt.

APB_PERI_BYTE_ERROR_EN.description: The enable signal for APB peripheral access interrupt.

APB_PERI_BYTE_ERROR_ADDR.description: Record the illegitimate address of  APB peripheral.

CPU_PERI_BYTE_ERROR_CLR.description: The clear signal for CPU peripheral access interrupt.

CPU_PERI_BYTE_ERROR_EN.description: The enable signal for CPU peripheral access interrupt.

CPU_PERI_BYTE_ERROR_ADDR.description: Record the illegitimate address of CPU peripheral.

CLK_EN.description: Enable the clock of permission control module when set to 1.

CH%sDATA.description: The read and write  data register for CHANNEL%s by apb fifo access.

DATA.description: The read and write  data register for CHANNEL%s by apb fifo access.

DIV_CNT.description: This register is used to configure the divider for clock of CHANNEL%s.

IDLE_THRES.description: When no edge is detected on the input signal and continuous clock cycles is longer than this register value, received process is finished.

MEM_SIZE.description: This register is used to configure the maximum size of memory allocated to CHANNEL%s.

CARRIER_EFF_EN.description: 1: Add carrier modulation on the output signal only at the send data state for CHANNEL%s. 0: Add carrier modulation on the output signal at all state for CHANNEL%s. Only valid when RMT_CARRIER_EN_CH%s is 1.

CARRIER_EN.description: This is the carrier modulation enable-control bit for CHANNEL%s. 1: Add carrier modulation in the output signal. 0: No carrier modulation in sig_out.

CARRIER_OUT_LV.description:
This bit is used to configure the position of carrier wave for CHANNEL%s.

1'h0: add carrier wave on low level.

1'h1: add carrier wave on high level.

TX_START.description: Set this bit to start sending data on CHANNEL%s.

RX_EN.description: Set this bit to enable receiver to receive data on CHANNEL%s.

MEM_WR_RST.description: Set this bit to reset write ram address for CHANNEL%s by accessing receiver.

MEM_RD_RST.description: Set this bit to reset read ram address for CHANNEL%s by accessing transmitter.

APB_MEM_RST.description: Set this bit to reset W/R ram address for CHANNEL%s by accessing apb fifo.

MEM_OWNER.description:
This register marks the ownership of CHANNEL%s's ram block.

1'h1: Receiver is using the ram. 

1'h0: Transmitter is using the ram.

TX_CONTI_MODE.description: Set this bit to restart transmission  from the first data to the last data in CHANNEL%s.

RX_FILTER_EN.description: This is the receive filter's enable bit for CHANNEL%s.

RX_FILTER_THRES.description: Ignores the input pulse when its width is smaller than this register value in APB clock periods (in receive mode).

CHK_RX_CARRIER_EN.description: Set this bit to enable memory loop read mode when carrier modulation is enabled for channel %s.

REF_ALWAYS_ON.description:
This bit is used to select the base clock for CHANNEL%s.

1'h1: clk_apb    1'h0:clk_ref

IDLE_OUT_LV.description: This bit configures the level of output signal in CHANNEL%s when the latter is in IDLE state.

IDLE_OUT_EN.description: This is the output enable-control bit for CHANNEL%s in IDLE state.

TX_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop the transmitter of CHANNEL%s sending data out.

MEM_WADDR_EX.description: This register records the memory address offset when receiver of CHANNEL%s is using the RAM.

MEM_RADDR_EX.description: This register records the memory address offset when transmitter of CHANNEL%s is using the RAM.

STATE.description: This register records the FSM status of CHANNEL%s.

MEM_OWNER_ERR.description: This status bit will be set when the ownership of memory block is wrong.

MEM_FULL.description: This status bit will be set if the receiver receives more data than the memory size.

MEM_EMPTY.description: This status bit will be set when the data to be set is more than memory size and the wraparound mode is disabled.

APB_MEM_WR_ERR.description: This status bit will be set if the offset address out of memory size when writes via APB bus.

APB_MEM_RD_ERR.description: This status bit will be set if the offset address out of memory size when reads via APB bus.

APB_MEM_WADDR.description: This register records the memory address offset when writes RAM over APB bus.

APB_MEM_RADDR.description: This register records the memory address offset when reads RAM over APB bus.

CH%s_TX_END.description: The interrupt raw bit for CHANNEL%s. Triggered when transmission done.

CH%s_RX_END.description: The interrupt raw bit for CHANNEL%s. Triggered when reception done.

CH%s_ERR.description: The interrupt raw bit for CHANNEL%s. Triggered when error occurs.

CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT.description: The interrupt raw bit for CHANNEL%s. Triggered when transmitter sent more data than configured value.

CH%s_TX_LOOP.description: The interrupt raw bit for CHANNEL%s. Triggered when the loop count reaches the configured threshold value.

CH%s_TX_END.description: The masked interrupt status bit for CH%s_TX_END_INT.

CH%s_RX_END.description: The masked interrupt status bit for CH%s_RX_END_INT.

CH%s_ERR.description: The masked interrupt status bit for CH%s_ERR_INT.

CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT.description: The masked interrupt status bit for CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT_INT.

CH%s_TX_LOOP.description: The masked interrupt status bit for CH%s_TX_LOOP_INT.

CH%s_TX_END.description: The interrupt enabled bit  for CH%s_TX_END_INT.

CH%s_RX_END.description: The interrupt enabled bit  for CH%s_RX_END_INT.

CH%s_ERR.description: The interrupt enabled bit  for CH%s_ERR_INT.

CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT.description: The interrupt enabled bit for CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT_INT.

CH%s_TX_LOOP.description: The interrupt enabled bit  for CH%s_TX_LOOP_INT.

CH%s_TX_END.description: Set this bit to clear the CH%s_TX_END_INT interrupt.

CH%s_RX_END.description: Set this bit to clear the CH%s_RX_END_INT interrupt.

CH%s_ERR.description: Set this bit to clear the CH%s_ERR_INT interrupt.

CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT.description: Set this bit to clear the CH%s_TX_THR_EVENT_INT interrupt.

CH%s_TX_LOOP.description: Set this bit to clear the CH%s_TX_LOOP_INT interrupt.

CARRIER_LOW.description: This register is used to configure carrier wave 's low level clock period for CHANNEL%s.

CARRIER_HIGH.description: This register is used to configure carrier wave 's high level clock period for CHANNEL%s.

TX_LIM.description: This register is used to configure the maximum entries that CHANNEL%s can send out.

TX_LOOP_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the maximum loop count when tx_conti_mode is valid.

TX_LOOP_CNT_EN.description: This register is the enabled bit for loop count.

LOOP_COUNT_RESET.description: This register is used to reset the loop count when tx_conti_mode is valid.

APB_FIFO_MASK.description: 1'h1: access memory directly.   1'h0: access memory by FIFO.

MEM_TX_WRAP_EN.description: This is the enable bit for wraparound mode: it will resume sending at the start when the data to be sent is more than its memory size.

MEM_CLK_FORCE_ON.description: Set this bit to enable the clock for RMT memory.

MEM_FORCE_PD.description: Set this bit to power down RMT memory.

MEM_FORCE_PU.description: 1: Disable RMT memory light sleep power down function. 0: Power down RMT memory when RMT is in light sleep mode.

CLK_EN.description: RMT register clock gate enable signal. 1: Power up the drive clock of registers. 0: Power down the drive clock of registers

CH0.description: Set this bit to enable CHANNEL0 to start sending data synchronously with other enabled channels.

CH1.description: Set this bit to enable CHANNEL1 to start sending data synchronously with other enabled channels.

CH2.description: Set this bit to enable CHANNEL2 to start sending data synchronously with other enabled channels.

CH3.description: Set this bit to enable CHANNEL3 to start sending data synchronously with other enabled channels.

EN.description: This register is used to enable multiple of channels to start sending data synchronously.

CH0.description: This register is used to reset the clock divider of CHANNEL0.

CH1.description: This register is used to reset the clock divider of CHANNEL1.

CH2.description: This register is used to reset the clock divider of CHANNEL2.

CH3.description: This register is used to reset the clock divider of CHANNEL3.

CARRIER_LOW_THRES.description: The low level period in a carrier modulation mode is (REG_RMT_REG_CARRIER_LOW_THRES_CH%s + 1) for channel %s.

CARRIER_HIGH_THRES.description: The high level period in a carrier modulation mode is (REG_RMT_REG_CARRIER_HIGH_THRES_CH%s + 1) for channel %s.

RTC_GPIO_OUT_W1TS.description: RTC GPIO output bit set register

RTC_GPIO_OUT_W1TC.description: RTC GPIO output bit clear register

RTC_GPIO_ENABLE_W1TS.description: RTC GPIO output enable bit set register

ENABLE_W1TC.description: RTC GPIO output enable bit clear register

RTC_GPIO_STATUS_W1TS.description: RTC GPIO interrupt status bit set register

RTC_GPIO_STATUS_W1TC.description: RTC GPIO interrupt status bit clear register

XTL_EXT_CTR.description: Crystal power down enable GPIO source

GPIO_OUT_DATA.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 output register. Bit10 corresponds to GPIO0, bit11 corresponds to GPIO1, etc.

GPIO_OUT_DATA_W1TS.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 output set register. If the value 1 is written to a bit here, the corresponding bit in RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_OUT_REG will be set to 1. Recommended operation: use this register to set RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_OUT_REG.

GPIO_OUT_DATA_W1TC.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 output clear register. If the value 1 is written to a bit here, the corresponding bit in RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_OUT_REG will be cleared. Recommended operation: use this register to clear RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_OUT_REG.

REG_RTCIO_REG_GPIO_ENABLE.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 output enable. Bit10 corresponds to GPIO0, bit11 corresponds to GPIO1, etc. If the bit is set to 1, it means this GPIO pad is output.

REG_RTCIO_REG_GPIO_ENABLE_W1TS.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 output enable set register. If the value 1 is written to a bit here, the corresponding bit in RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_ENABLE_REG will be set to 1. Recommended operation: use this register to set RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_ENABLE_REG.

ENABLE_W1TC.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 output enable clear register. If the value 1 is written to a bit here, the corresponding bit in RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_ENABLE_REG will be cleared. Recommended operation: use this register to clear RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_ENABLE_REG.

GPIO_STATUS_INT.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 interrupt status register. Bit10 corresponds to GPIO0, bit11 corresponds to GPIO1, etc. This register should be used together with RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_PINn_INT_TYPE in RTCIO_RTC_GPIO_PINn_REG. 0: no interrupt; 1: corresponding interrupt.

GPIO_STATUS_INT_W1TS.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 interrupt set register. If the value 1 is written to a bit here, the corresponding bit in RTCIO_GPIO_STATUS_INT will be set to 1. Recommended operation: use this register to set RTCIO_GPIO_STATUS_INT.

GPIO_STATUS_INT_W1TC.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 interrupt clear register. If the value 1 is written to a bit here, the corresponding bit in RTCIO_GPIO_STATUS_INT will be cleared. Recommended operation: use this register to clear RTCIO_GPIO_STATUS_INT.

GPIO_IN_NEXT.description: GPIO0 ~ 21 input value. Bit10 corresponds to GPIO0, bit11 corresponds to GPIO1, etc. Each bit represents a pad input value, 1 for high level, and 0 for low level.

PAD_DRIVER.description: Pad driver selection. 0: normal output. 1: open drain.

GPIO_PIN_INT_TYPE.description: GPIO interrupt type selection. 0: GPIO interrupt disabled. 1: rising edge trigger. 2: falling edge trigger. 3: any edge trigger. 4: low level trigger. 5: high level trigger.

GPIO_PIN_WAKEUP_ENABLE.description: GPIO wake-up enable. This will only wake up ESP32-S2 from Light-sleep.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable in normal execution.

SLP_SEL.description: 0: no sleep mode. 1: enable sleep mode.

MUX_SEL.description: Connect the RTC pad input to digital pad input.  0 is available.

TIE_OPT.description: The tie option of touch sensor. 0: tie low. 1: tie high.

DAC.description: Touch sensor slope control. 3-bit for each touch pad, defaults to 0x4.

RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

X32P_SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode.

X32P_MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO.

X32P_RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

X32P_RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

X32P_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

X32N_SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode.

X32N_MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO.

X32N_RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

X32N_RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

X32N_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

PDAC1_DAC.description: Configure DAC_1 output when RTCIO_PDAC1_DAC_XPD_FORCE is set to 1.

PDAC1_XPD_DAC.description: When RTCIO_PDAC1_DAC_XPD_FORCE is set to 1, 1: enable DAC_1 output. 0: disable DAC_1 output.

PDAC1_DAC_XPD_FORCE.description: 1: use RTCIO_PDAC1_XPD_DAC to control DAC_1 output. 0: use SAR ADC FSM to control DAC_1 output.

PDAC1_SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode

PDAC1_MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO

PDAC1_RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

PDAC1_RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

PDAC1_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

PDAC2_DAC.description: Configure DAC_2 output when RTCIO_PDAC2_DAC_XPD_FORCE is set to 1.

PDAC2_XPD_DAC.description: When RTCIO_PDAC2_DAC_XPD_FORCE is set to 1, 1: enable DAC_2 output. 0: disable DAC_2 output.

PDAC2_DAC_XPD_FORCE.description: 1: use RTCIO_PDAC2_XPD_DAC to control DAC_2 output. 0: use SAR ADC FSM to control DAC_2 output.

PDAC2_SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode.

PDAC2_MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO.

PDAC2_RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

PDAC2_RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

PDAC2_DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA: 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable in normal execution.

SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode

MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO.

RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable in normal execution.

SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode.

MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO.

RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

FUN_IE.description: Input enable in normal execution.

SLP_SEL.description: 1: enable sleep mode. 0: no sleep mode.

MUX_SEL.description: 1: use RTC GPIO. 0: use digital GPIO.

RUE.description: Pull-down enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-down enabled. 0: internal pull-down disabled.

RDE.description: Pull-up enable of the pad. 1: internal pull-up enabled. 0: internal pull-up disabled.

DRV.description: Select the drive strength of the pad. 0: ~5 mA. 1: ~10 mA. 2: ~20 mA. 3: ~40 mA.

SEL.description:
GPIO[0-17] can be used to wake up the chip when the chip is in the sleep mode. This register prompts the pad source to wake up the chip when the latter is indeep/light sleep mode. 
0: select GPIO0; 1: select GPIO2, etc

Select the external crystal power down enable source to get into sleep mode. 0: select GPIO0. 1: select GPIO1, etc. The input value on this pin XOR RTC_CNTL_EXT_XTL_CONF_REG[30] is the crystal power down enable signal.

SAR_I2C_SCL_SEL.description: Selects a pad the RTC I2C SCL signal connects to. 0: use TOUCH PAD0. 1: use TOUCH PAD2.

SAR_I2C_SDA_SEL.description: Selects a pad the RTC I2C SDA signal connects to. 0: use TOUCH PAD1. 1: use TOUCH PAD3.

SAR_READER1_CTRL.description: RTC ADC1 data and sampling control

SAR_MEAS1_CTRL2.description: Control RTC ADC1 conversion and status

SAR_MEAS1_MUX.description: Select the controller for SAR ADC1

SAR_READER2_CTRL.description: RTC ADC2 data and sampling control

SAR_MEAS2_CTRL2.description: Control RTC ADC2 conversion and status

SAR_MEAS2_MUX.description: Select the controller for SAR ADC2

SAR_SLAVE_ADDR1.description: Configure slave addresses 0-1 of RTC I2C

SAR_SLAVE_ADDR2.description: Configure slave addresses 2-3 of RTC I2C

SAR_SLAVE_ADDR3.description: Configure slave addresses 4-5 of RTC I2C

SAR_SLAVE_ADDR4.description: Configure slave addresses 6-7 of RTC I2C

SAR1_INT_EN.description: Enable SAR ADC1 to send out interrupt.

RTC_SARADC_CLKGATE_EN.description: Enable bit of SAR ADC clock gate.

MEAS1_DONE_SAR.description: Indicate SAR ADC1 conversion is done.

MEAS1_START_SAR.description: SAR ADC1 controller (in RTC) starts conversion, active only when SENS_MEAS1_START_FORCE = 1.

MEAS1_START_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC1 controller (in RTC) is started by software. 0: SAR ADC1 controller is started by ULP coprocessor.

SAR1_EN_PAD.description: SAR ADC1 pad enable bitmap, active only when SENS_SAR1_EN_PAD_FORCE = 1.

SAR1_EN_PAD_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC1 pad enable bitmap is controlled by software. 0: SAR ADC1 pad enable bitmap is controlled by ULP coprocessor.

SAR1_DIG_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC1 controlled by DIG ADC1 CTRL

SAR1_ATTEN.description: 2-bit attenuation for each pad. [1:0] is used for channel 0, [3:2] is used for channel 1, etc.

SAR1_DAC_XPD_FSM.description: Control of DAC. 4’b0010: disable DAC. 4’b0000: power up DAC by FSM. 4’b0011: power up DAC by software.

SAR2_INT_EN.description: enable saradc2 to send out interrupt

MEAS2_DONE_SAR.description: Indicate SAR ADC2 conversion is done.

MEAS2_START_SAR.description: SAR ADC2 controller (in RTC) starts conversion, active only when SENS_MEAS2_START_FORCE = 1.

MEAS2_START_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC2 controller (in RTC) is started by software. 0: SAR ADC2 controller is started by ULP coprocessor.

SAR2_EN_PAD.description: SAR ADC2 pad enable bitmap, active only whenSENS_SAR2_EN_PAD_FORCE = 1.

SAR2_EN_PAD_FORCE.description: 1: SAR ADC2 pad enable bitmap is controlled by software. 0: SAR ADC2 pad enable bitmap is controlled by ULP coprocessor.

SAR2_PWDET_CCT.description: SAR2_PWDET_CCT, PA power detector capacitance tuning.

SAR2_RTC_FORCE.description: In sleep, force to use RTC to control ADC.

SAR2_ATTEN.description: 2-bit attenuation for each pad. [1:0] is used for channel 0, [3:2] is used for channel 1, etc.

TSENS_INT_EN.description: Enable temperature sensor to send out interrupt.

TSENS_POWER_UP_FORCE.description: 1: dump out and power up controlled by software. 0: by FSM.

TSENS_DUMP_OUT.description: Temperature sensor dump out only active when SENS_TSENS_POWER_UP_FORCE = 1.

SAR_I2C_CTRL.description:
RTC I2C control data. Active only when SENS_SAR_I2C_START_FORCE =
1.

SAR_I2C_START.description: Start RTC I2C. Active only when SENS_SAR_I2C_START_FORCE = 1

SAR_I2C_START_FORCE.description: 0: RTC I2C started by FSM. 1: RTC I2C started by software.

TOUCH_APPROACH_PAD2.description: Indicate which pad is selected as proximity pad2

TOUCH_APPROACH_PAD1.description: Indicate which pad is selected as proximity pad1

TOUCH_APPROACH_PAD0.description: Indicate which pad is selected as proximity pad0

TOUCH_MEAS_DONE.description: Signal flag that indicates one touch pad is done.

TOUCH_DENOISE_DATA.description: Denoise measure value from touch sensor 0.

TOUCH_PAD1_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 1, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD2_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 2, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD3_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 3, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD4_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 4, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD5_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 5, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD6_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 6, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD7_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 7, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD8_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 8, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD9_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 9, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD10_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 10, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD11_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 11, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD12_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 12, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD13_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 13, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_PAD14_DATA.description: The data of touch pad 14, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_SLP_DATA.description: The data of touch sleep pad, depending on the setting of SENS_TOUCH_DATA_SEL.

TOUCH_SLP_APPROACH_CNT.description: Count status of sleep pad in proximity mode.

SW_FSTEP.description: Frequency step for CW generator can be used to adjust the frequency.

SW_TONE_EN.description: 0: disable CW generator. 1: enable CW generator.

DAC_DIG_FORCE.description: 0: DAC1 and DAC2 do not use DMA. 1: DAC1 and DAC2 use DMA.

DAC_DC1.description: DC offset for DAC1 CW generator.

DAC_DC2.description: DC offset for DAC2 CW generator.

DAC_SCALE1.description: DAC1 scaling. 00: no scale. 01: scale to 1/2. 10: scale to 1/4. 11: scale to 1/8.

DAC_SCALE2.description: DAC2 scaling. 00: no scale. 01: scale to 1/2. 10: scale to 1/4. 11: scale to 1/8.

DAC_INV1.description: Invert DAC1. 00: do not invert any bits. 01: invert all bits. 10: invert MSB. 11: invert all bits except MSB.

DAC_INV2.description: Invert DAC2. 00: do not invert any bits. 01: invert all bits. 10: invert MSB. 11: invert all bits except MSB.

DAC_CW_EN1.description: 1: select CW generator as source for PDAC1_DAC. 0: select register RT- CIO_PDAC1_DAC as source for PDAC1_DAC.

DAC_CW_EN2.description: 1: select CW generator as source for PDAC2_DAC. 0: select register RT- CIO_PDAC2_DAC as source for PDAC2_DAC.

COCPU_RESET_N.description: Check ULP-RISCV whether in reset state

COCPU_EOI.description: Check ULP-RISCV whether in interrupt state

COCPU_TRAP.description: Check ULP-RISCV whether in trap state

XPD_HALL.description: Power on hall sensor and connect to VP and VN

XPD_HALL_FORCE.description: 1: XPD HALL is controlled by SW. 0: XPD HALL is controlled by FSM in ULP-coprocessor

HALL_PHASE_FORCE.description: 1: HALL PHASE is controlled by SW  0: HALL PHASE is controlled by FSM in ULP-coprocessor

IOMUX_CLK_GATE_EN.description: IO MUX clock gate enable bit

SLV_WRBUF_DLEN.description: SPI slave Wr_BUF interrupt and CONF control register

SLV_RDBUF_DLEN.description: SPI magic error and slave control register

FSM.description: SPI master status and DMA read byte control register

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The latest SPI DMA  RX descriptor address receiving error

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The latest SPI DMA  eof RX descriptor address

INLINK_DSCR.description: Current SPI DMA RX descriptor pointer

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: Next SPI DMA RX descriptor pointer

INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: Current SPI DMA RX buffer pointer

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: The latest SPI DMA  eof TX buffer address

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The latest SPI DMA  eof TX descriptor address

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: Current SPI DMA TX descriptor pointer

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: Next SPI DMA TX descriptor pointer

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: Current SPI DMA TX buffer pointer

CONF_BITLEN.description: Define the spi_clk cycles of  SPI_CONF state. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR.description: User define command enable.  An operation will be triggered when the bit is set. The bit will be cleared once the operation done.1: enable 0: disable. Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

USR_ADDR_VALUE.description: [31:8]:address to slave, [7:0]:Reserved. Can be configured in CONF state.

EXT_HOLD_EN.description: Set the bit to hold spi. The bit is combined with SPI_USR_PREP_HOLD,SPI_USR_CMD_HOLD,SPI_USR_ADDR_HOLD,SPI_USR_DUMMY_HOLD,SPI_USR_DIN_HOLD,SPI_USR_DOUT_HOLD and SPI_USR_HOLD_POL. Can be configured in CONF state.

DUMMY_OUT.description: In the dummy phase the signal level of spi is output by the spi controller. Can be configured in CONF state.

FADDR_DUAL.description: Apply 2-bit mode during addr phase 1:enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FADDR_QUAD.description: Apply 4-bit mode during addr phase 1:enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FADDR_OCT.description: Apply 8-bit mode during addr phase 1:enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FCMD_DUAL.description: Apply 2-bit mode during command phase 1:enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FCMD_QUAD.description: Apply 4-bit mode during command phase 1:enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FCMD_OCT.description: Apply 8-bit mode during command phase 1:enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FREAD_DUAL.description: In the read operations, read-data phase is in 2-bit mode. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

FREAD_QUAD.description: In the read operations read-data phase is in 4-bit mode. 1: enable 0: disable.  Can be configured in CONF state.

FREAD_OCT.description: In the read operations read-data phase is in 8-bit mode. 1: enable 0: disable.  Can be configured in CONF state.

Q_POL.description: The bit is used to set MISO line polarity, 1: high 0, low. Can be configured in CONF state.

D_POL.description: The bit is used to set MOSI line polarity, 1: high 0, low. Can be configured in CONF state.

WP.description: Write protect signal output when SPI is idle.  1: output high, 0: output low.  Can be configured in CONF state.

RD_BIT_ORDER.description: In read-data (MISO) phase 1: LSB first 0: MSB first. Can be configured in CONF state.

WR_BIT_ORDER.description: In command address write-data (MOSI) phases 1: LSB firs 0: MSB first. Can be configured in CONF state.

CLK_MODE.description: SPI clock mode bits. 0: SPI clock is off when CS inactive 1: SPI clock is delayed one cycle after CS inactive 2: SPI clock is delayed two cycles after CS inactive 3: SPI clock is alwasy on. Can be configured in CONF state.

CLK_MODE_13.description: {CPOL, CPHA},1: support spi clk mode 1 and 3, first edge output data B[0]/B[7].  0: support spi clk mode 0 and 2, first edge output data B[1]/B[6].

RSCK_DATA_OUT.description: It saves half a cycle when tsck is the same as rsck. 1: output data at rsck posedge   0: output data at tsck posedge

W16_17_WR_ENA.description: 1:SPI_BUF16~SPI_BUF17 can be written   0:SPI_BUF16~SPI_BUF17 can not  be written. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_HOLD_DELAY.description: SPI cs signal is delayed by spi clock cycles. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_SETUP_TIME.description: (cycles+1) of prepare phase by spi clock this bits are combined with SPI_CS_SETUP bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_HOLD_TIME.description: delay cycles of cs pin by spi clock this bits are combined with SPI_CS_HOLD bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_DELAY_MODE.description: spi_cs signal is delayed by spi_clk . 0: zero 1: if SPI_CK_OUT_EDGE or SPI_CK_IDLE_EDGE is set 1 delayed by half cycle  else delayed by one cycle 2: if SPI_CK_OUT_EDGE or  SPI_CK_IDLE_EDGE is set 1 delayed by one cycle, else delayed by half cycle 3: delayed one cycle. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_DELAY_NUM.description: spi_cs signal is delayed by system clock cycles. Can be configured in CONF state.

CLKCNT_L.description: In the master mode it must be equal to SPI_CLKCNT_N. In the slave mode it must be 0. Can be configured in CONF state.

CLKCNT_H.description: In the master mode it must be floor((SPI_CLKCNT_N+1)/2-1). In the slave mode it must be 0. Can be configured in CONF state.

CLKCNT_N.description: In the master mode it is the divider of spi_clk. So spi_clk frequency is system/(SPI_CLKDIV_PRE+1)/(SPI_CLKCNT_N+1). Can be configured in CONF state.

CLKDIV_PRE.description: In the master mode it is pre-divider of spi_clk.  Can be configured in CONF state.

CLK_EQU_SYSCLK.description: In the master mode 1: spi_clk is eqaul to system 0: spi_clk is divided from system clock. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUTDIN.description: Set the bit to enable full duplex communication. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

QPI_MODE.description: Both for master mode and slave mode. 1: spi controller is in QPI mode. 0: others. Can be configured in CONF state.

OPI_MODE.description: Just for master mode. 1: spi controller is in OPI mode (all in 8-bit mode). 0: others. Can be configured in CONF state.

TSCK_I_EDGE.description: In the slave mode, this bit can be used to change the polarity of tsck. 0: tsck = spi_ck_i. 1:tsck = !spi_ck_i.

CS_HOLD.description: spi cs keep low when spi is in  done  phase. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_SETUP.description: spi cs is enable when spi is in  prepare  phase. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

RSCK_I_EDGE.description: In the slave mode, this bit can be used to change the polarity of rsck. 0: rsck = !spi_ck_i. 1:rsck = spi_ck_i.

CK_OUT_EDGE.description: the bit combined with SPI_DOUT_MODE register to set mosi signal delay mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

RD_BYTE_ORDER.description: In read-data (MISO) phase 1: big-endian 0: little_endian. Can be configured in CONF state.

WR_BYTE_ORDER.description: In command address write-data (MOSI) phases 1: big-endian 0: litte_endian. Can be configured in CONF state.

FWRITE_DUAL.description: In the write operations read-data phase is in 2-bit mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

FWRITE_QUAD.description: In the write operations read-data phase is in 4-bit mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

FWRITE_OCT.description: In the write operations read-data phase is in 8-bit mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_CONF_NXT.description: 1: Enable the DMA CONF phase of next seg-trans operation, which means seg-trans will continue. 0: The seg-trans will end after the current SPI seg-trans or this is not seg-trans mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

SIO.description: Set the bit to enable 3-line half duplex communication mosi and miso signals share the same pin. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_HOLD_POL.description: It is combined with hold bits to set the polarity of spi hold line 1: spi will be held when spi hold line is high 0: spi will be held when spi hold line is low. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_DOUT_HOLD.description: spi is hold at data out state the bit are combined with SPI_USR_HOLD_POL bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_DIN_HOLD.description: spi is hold at data in state the bit are combined with SPI_USR_HOLD_POL bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_DUMMY_HOLD.description: spi is hold at dummy state the bit are combined with SPI_USR_HOLD_POL bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_ADDR_HOLD.description: spi is hold at address state the bit are combined with SPI_USR_HOLD_POL bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_CMD_HOLD.description: spi is hold at command state the bit are combined with SPI_USR_HOLD_POL bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_PREP_HOLD.description: spi is hold at prepare state the bit are combined with SPI_USR_HOLD_POL bit. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_MISO_HIGHPART.description: read-data phase only access to high-part of the buffer SPI_BUF8~SPI_BUF17. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_MOSI_HIGHPART.description: write-data phase only access to high-part of the buffer SPI_BUF8~SPI_BUF17. 1: enable 0: disable.  Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_DUMMY_IDLE.description: spi clock is disable in dummy phase when the bit is enable. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_MOSI.description: This bit enable the write-data phase of an operation. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_MISO.description: This bit enable the read-data phase of an operation. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_DUMMY.description: This bit enable the dummy phase of an operation. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_ADDR.description: This bit enable the address phase of an operation. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_COMMAND.description: This bit enable the command phase of an operation. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_DUMMY_CYCLELEN.description: The length in spi_clk cycles of dummy phase. The register value shall be (cycle_num-1). Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_ADDR_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of address phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1). Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_COMMAND_VALUE.description: The value of  command. Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_COMMAND_BITLEN.description: The length in bits of command phase. The register value shall be (bit_num-1). Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_MOSI_DBITLEN.description: The length in bits of write-data. The register value shall be (bit_num-1). Can be configured in CONF state.

USR_MISO_DBITLEN.description: The length in bits of  read-data. The register value shall be (bit_num-1). Can be configured in CONF state.

CS0_DIS.description: SPI CS0 pin enable, 1: disable CS0, 0: SPI_CS0 signal is from/to CS0 pin. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS1_DIS.description: SPI CS1 pin enable, 1: disable CS1, 0: SPI_CS1 signal is from/to CS1 pin. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS2_DIS.description: SPI CS2 pin enable, 1: disable CS2, 0: SPI_CS2 signal is from/to CS2 pin. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS3_DIS.description: SPI CS3 pin enable, 1: disable CS3, 0: SPI_CS3 signal is from/to CS3 pin. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS4_DIS.description: SPI CS4 pin enable, 1: disable CS4, 0: SPI_CS4 signal is from/to CS4 pin. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS5_DIS.description: SPI CS5 pin enable, 1: disable CS5, 0: SPI_CS5 signal is from/to CS5 pin. Can be configured in CONF state.

CK_DIS.description: 1: spi clk out disable,  0: spi clk out enable. Can be configured in CONF state.

MASTER_CS_POL.description: In the master mode the bits are the polarity of spi cs line, the value is equivalent to spi_cs ^ SPI_MASTER_CS_POL. Can be configured in CONF state.

CLK_DATA_DTR_EN.description: 1: SPI master DTR mode is applied to SPI clk, data and spi_dqs.  0: SPI master DTR mode is  only applied to spi_dqs. This bit should be used with bit 17/18/19.

DATA_DTR_EN.description: 1: SPI clk and data of SPI_DOUT and SPI_DIN state are in DTR mode, including master 1/2/4/8-bm.  0:  SPI clk and data of SPI_DOUT and SPI_DIN state are in STR mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

ADDR_DTR_EN.description: 1: SPI clk and data of SPI_SEND_ADDR state are in DTR mode, including master 1/2/4/8-bm.  0:  SPI clk and data of SPI_SEND_ADDR state are in STR mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

CMD_DTR_EN.description: 1: SPI clk and data of SPI_SEND_CMD state are in DTR mode, including master 1/2/4/8-bm.  0:  SPI clk and data of SPI_SEND_CMD state are in STR mode. Can be configured in CONF state.

CD_DATA_SET.description: 1: spi_cd = !SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE when SPI_ST[3:0] is in SPI_DOUT or SPI_DIN state.  0: spi_cd = SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE. Can be configured in CONF state.

CD_DUMMY_SET.description: 1: spi_cd = !SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE when SPI_ST[3:0] is in SPI_DUMMY state.  0: spi_cd = SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE. Can be configured in CONF state.

CD_ADDR_SET.description: 1: spi_cd = !SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE when SPI_ST[3:0] is in SPI_SEND_ADDR state.  0: spi_cd = SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE. Can be configured in CONF state.

SLAVE_CS_POL.description: spi slave input cs polarity select. 1: inv  0: not change. Can be configured in CONF state.

DQS_IDLE_EDGE.description: The default value of spi_dqs. Can be configured in CONF state.

CD_CMD_SET.description: 1: spi_cd = !SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE when SPI_ST[3:0] is in SPI_SEND_CMD state.  0: spi_cd = SPI_CD_IDLE_EDGE. Can be configured in CONF state.

CD_IDLE_EDGE.description: The default value of spi_cd. Can be configured in CONF state.

CK_IDLE_EDGE.description: 1: spi clk line is high when idle     0: spi clk line is low when idle. Can be configured in CONF state.

CS_KEEP_ACTIVE.description: spi cs line keep low when the bit is set. Can be configured in CONF state.

QUAD_DIN_PIN_SWAP.description: 1:  spi quad input swap enable  0:  spi quad input swap disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

TRANS_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of any operation in both the master mode and the slave mode.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

INT_RD_BUF_DONE_EN.description: SPI_SLV_RD_BUF_DONE Interrupt enable. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

INT_WR_BUF_DONE_EN.description: SPI_SLV_WR_BUF_DONE Interrupt enable. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

INT_RD_DMA_DONE_EN.description: SPI_SLV_RD_DMA_DONE Interrupt enable. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

INT_WR_DMA_DONE_EN.description: SPI_SLV_WR_DMA_DONE Interrupt enable. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

INT_TRANS_DONE_EN.description: SPI_TRANS_DONE Interrupt enable. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

INT_DMA_SEG_TRANS_EN.description: SPI_DMA_SEG_TRANS_DONE Interrupt enable. 1: enable 0: disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

SEG_MAGIC_ERR_INT_EN.description: 1: Enable seg magic value error interrupt. 0: Others. Can be configured in CONF state.

TRANS_CNT.description: The operations counter in both the master mode and the slave mode.

TRANS_DONE_AUTO_CLR_EN.description: SPI_TRANS_DONE auto clear enable, clear it 3 apb cycles after the pos edge of SPI_TRANS_DONE.  0:disable. 1: enable. Can be configured in CONF state.

MODE.description: Set SPI work mode. 1: slave mode 0: master mode.

SOFT_RESET.description: Software reset enable, reset the spi clock line cs line and data lines. Can be configured in CONF state.

SLV_ADDR_ERR_CLR.description: 1: Clear SPI_SLV_ADDR_ERR. 0: not valid. Can be changed by CONF_buf.

SLV_CMD_ERR_CLR.description: 1: Clear SPI_SLV_CMD_ERR. 0: not valid.  Can be changed by CONF_buf.

SLV_NO_QPI_EN.description: 1: spi slave QPI mode is not supported. 0: spi slave QPI mode is supported.

SLV_ADDR_ERR.description: 1: The address value of the last SPI transfer is not supported by SPI slave. 0: The address value is supported or no address value is received.

SLV_CMD_ERR.description: 1: The command value of the last SPI transfer is not supported by SPI slave. 0: The command value is supported or no command value is received.

SLV_WR_DMA_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of dma write operation in the slave mode.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

SLV_LAST_COMMAND.description: In the slave mode it is the value of command.

SLV_LAST_ADDR.description: In the slave mode it is the value of address.

SLV_WR_BUF_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of write-buffer operation in the slave mode.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

CONF_BASE_BITLEN.description: The basic spi_clk cycles of CONF state. The real cycle length of CONF state, if SPI_USR_CONF is enabled, is SPI_CONF_BASE_BITLEN[6:0] + SPI_CONF_BITLEN[23:0].

SLV_DMA_RD_BYTELEN.description: In the slave mode it is the length in bytes for read operations. The register value shall be byte_num.

SLV_RD_BUF_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of read-buffer operation in the slave mode.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

SEG_MAGIC_ERR.description: 1: The recent magic value in CONF buffer is not right in master DMA seg-trans mode. 0: others.

SLV_DATA_BYTELEN.description: The full-duplex or half-duplex data byte length of the last SPI transfer in slave mode. In half-duplex mode, this value is controlled by bits [23:20].

SLV_RDDMA_BYTELEN_EN.description: 1: SPI_SLV_DATA_BYTELEN stores data byte length of master-read-slave data length in DMA controlled mode(Rd_DMA). 0: others

SLV_WRDMA_BYTELEN_EN.description: 1: SPI_SLV_DATA_BYTELEN stores data byte length of master-write-to-slave data length in DMA controlled mode(Wr_DMA). 0: others

SLV_RDBUF_BYTELEN_EN.description: 1: SPI_SLV_DATA_BYTELEN stores data byte length of master-read-slave data length in CPU controlled mode(Rd_BUF). 0: others

SLV_WRBUF_BYTELEN_EN.description: 1: SPI_SLV_DATA_BYTELEN stores data byte length of master-write-to-slave data length in CPU controlled mode(Wr_BUF). 0: others

DMA_SEG_MAGIC_VALUE.description: The magic value of BM table in master DMA seg-trans.

SLV_RD_DMA_DONE.description: The interrupt raw bit for the completion of Rd-DMA operation in the slave mode.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

USR_CONF.description: 1: Enable the DMA CONF phase of current seg-trans operation, which means seg-trans will start. 0: This is not seg-trans mode.

ST.description: The status of spi state machine. 0: idle state, 1: preparation state, 2: send command state, 3: send data state, 4: red data state, 5:write data state, 6: wait state, 7: done state.

MST_DMA_RD_BYTELEN.description: Define the master DMA read byte length in non seg-conf-trans or seg-conf-trans mode. Invalid when SPI_RX_EOF_EN is 0. Can be configured in CONF state..

INT_HOLD_ENA.description: This register is for two SPI masters to share the same cs clock and data signals. The bits of one SPI are set, if the other SPI is busy, the SPI will be hold. 1(3): hold at  idle  phase 2: hold at  prepare  phase. Can be configured in CONF state.

VAL.description: spi hold output value, which should be used with SPI_HOLD_OUT_EN. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_EN.description: Enable set spi output hold value to spi_hold_reg. It can be used to hold spi state machine with SPI_EXT_HOLD_EN and other usr hold signals. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_TIME.description: set the hold cycles of output spi_hold signal when SPI_HOLD_OUT_EN is enable. Can be configured in CONF state.

DMA_SEG_TRANS_DONE.description: 1:  spi master DMA full-duplex/half-duplex seg-trans ends or slave half-duplex seg-trans ends. And data has been pushed to corresponding memory.  0:  seg-trans is not ended or not occurred.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

IN_RST.description: The bit is used to reset in dma fsm and in data fifo pointer.

OUT_RST.description: The bit is used to reset out dma fsm and out data fifo pointer.

AHBM_FIFO_RST.description: Reset spi dma ahb master fifo pointer.

IN_LOOP_TEST.description: Set bit to test in link.

OUT_LOOP_TEST.description: Set bit to test out link.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: when the bit is set, DMA continue to use the next inlink node when the length of inlink is 0.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description: out eof flag generation mode . 1: when dma pop all data from fifo  0:when ahb push all data to fifo.

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description: read descriptor use burst mode when read data for memory.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description: read descriptor use burst mode when write data to memory.

OUT_DATA_BURST_EN.description: spi dma read data from memory in burst mode.

MEM_TRANS_EN.description: 1: Internal memory data transfer enable bit. Send SPI DMA RX buffer data to SPI DMA TX buffer. 0: Disable this function.

DMA_RX_STOP.description: spi dma read data stop  when in continue tx/rx mode.

DMA_TX_STOP.description: spi dma write data stop when in continue tx/rx mode.

DMA_SLV_SEG_TRANS_EN.description: Enable dma segment transfer in spi dma half slave mode. 1: enable. 0: disable.

SLV_RX_SEG_TRANS_CLR_EN.description: 1: spi_dma_infifo_full_vld is cleared by spi slave CMD5. 0: spi_dma_infifo_full_vld is cleared by SPI_TRANS_DONE.

SLV_TX_SEG_TRANS_CLR_EN.description: 1: spi_dma_outfifo_empty_vld is cleared by spi slave CMD6. 0: spi_dma_outfifo_empty_vld is cleared by SPI_TRANS_DONE.

RX_EOF_EN.description: 1: SPI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW is set when the number of dma pushed data bytes is equal to the value of SPI_SLV_DMA_RD_BYTELEN[19:0]/ SPI_MST_DMA_RD_BYTELEN[19:0] in spi dma transition.  0: SPI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW is set by SPI_TRANS_DONE in non-seg-trans or SPI_DMA_SEG_TRANS_DONE in seg-trans.

EXT_MEM_BK_SIZE.description: Select the external memory block size.

DMA_SEG_TRANS_CLR.description: 1: End slave seg-trans, which acts as 0x05 command. 2 or more end seg-trans signals will induce error in DMA RX.  0: others. Will be cleared in 1 APB CLK cycles by hardware..

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: The address of the first outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set the bit to stop to use outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set the bit to start to use outlink descriptor.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set the bit to mount on new outlink descriptors.

DMA_TX_ENA.description: spi dma write data status bit.

INLINK_ADDR.description: The address of the first inlink descriptor.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: when the bit is set, the inlink descriptor returns to the first link node when a packet is error.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set the bit to stop to use inlink descriptor.

INLINK_START.description: Set the bit to start to use inlink descriptor.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set the bit to mount on new inlink descriptors.

DMA_RX_ENA.description: SPI DMA read data status bit.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for outlink descriptor error. Can be configured in CONF state.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for inlink descriptor error. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for receiving error. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for completing receiving all the packets from host. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_DONE_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor . Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for sending a packet to host done. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for sending all the packets to host done. Can be configured in CONF state.

INFIFO_FULL_ERR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for infifo full error interrupt.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY_ERR_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for outfifo empty error interrupt.

SLV_CMD6_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for SPI slave CMD6 interrupt.

SLV_CMD7_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for SPI slave CMD7 interrupt.

SLV_CMD8_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for SPI slave CMD8 interrupt.

SLV_CMD9_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for SPI slave CMD9 interrupt.

SLV_CMDA_INT_ENA.description: The enable bit for SPI slave CMDA interrupt.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for outlink descriptor error. Can be configured in CONF state.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for inlink descriptor error. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for receiving error. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for completing receiving all the packets from host. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_DONE_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for sending a packet to host done. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for sending all the packets to host done. Can be configured in CONF state.

INFIFO_FULL_ERR_INT_RAW.description: 1:SPI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL and spi_push_data_prep are valid, which means that DMA Rx buffer is full but push is valid.  0: Others.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: 1:SPI_DMA_OUTFIFO_EMPTY and spi_pop_data_prep are valid, which means that there is no data to pop but pop is valid.  0: Others.  Can not be changed by CONF_buf.

SLV_CMD6_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for SPI slave CMD6 interrupt.

SLV_CMD7_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for SPI slave CMD7 interrupt.

SLV_CMD8_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for SPI slave CMD8 interrupt.

SLV_CMD9_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for SPI slave CMD9 interrupt.

SLV_CMDA_INT_RAW.description: The raw bit for SPI slave CMDA interrupt.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: The status bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ST.description: The status bit for outlink descriptor error.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_ST.description: The status bit for inlink descriptor error.

IN_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for receiving error.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for completing receiving all the packets from host.

OUT_DONE_INT_ST.description: The status bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor.

OUT_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for sending a packet to host done.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ST.description: The status bit for sending all the packets to host done.

INFIFO_FULL_ERR_INT_ST.description: The status bit for infifo full error.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY_ERR_INT_ST.description: The status bit for outfifo empty error.

SLV_CMD6_INT_ST.description: The status bit for SPI slave CMD6 interrupt.

SLV_CMD7_INT_ST.description: The status bit for SPI slave CMD7 interrupt.

SLV_CMD8_INT_ST.description: The status bit for SPI slave CMD8 interrupt.

SLV_CMD9_INT_ST.description: The status bit for SPI slave CMD9 interrupt.

SLV_CMDA_INT_ST.description: The status bit for SPI slave CMDA interrupt.

INLINK_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for lack of enough inlink descriptors. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for outlink descriptor error. Can be configured in CONF state.

INLINK_DSCR_ERROR_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for inlink descriptor error. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for completing usage of a inlink descriptor. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for receiving error. Can be configured in CONF state.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for completing receiving all the packets from host. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_DONE_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for completing usage of a outlink descriptor. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for sending a packet to host done. Can be configured in CONF state.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for sending all the packets to host done. Can be configured in CONF state.

INFIFO_FULL_ERR_INT_CLR.description: 1: Clear SPI_INFIFO_FULL_ERR_INT_RAW. 0: not valid. Can be changed by CONF_buf.

OUTFIFO_EMPTY_ERR_INT_CLR.description: 1: Clear SPI_OUTFIFO_EMPTY_ERR_INT_RAW signal. 0: not valid. Can be changed by CONF_buf.

SLV_CMD6_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for SPI slave CMD6 interrupt.

SLV_CMD7_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for SPI slave CMD7 interrupt.

SLV_CMD8_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for SPI slave CMD8 interrupt.

SLV_CMD9_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for SPI slave CMD9 interrupt.

SLV_CMDA_INT_CLR.description: The clear bit for SPI slave CMDA interrupt.

DMA_IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The inlink descriptor address when spi dma produce receiving error.

DMA_IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The last inlink descriptor address when spi dma produce from_suc_eof.

DMA_INLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current in descriptor pointer.

DMA_INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of next in descriptor pointer.

DMA_INLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current in descriptor data buffer pointer.

DMA_OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: The address of buffer relative to the outlink descriptor that produce eof.

DMA_OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: The last outlink descriptor address when spi dma produce to_eof.

DMA_OUTLINK_DSCR.description: The content of current out descriptor pointer.

DMA_OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: The content of next out descriptor pointer.

DMA_OUTLINK_DSCR_BF1.description: The content of current out descriptor data buffer pointer.

DMA_OUTFIFO_CNT.description: The remains of SPI dma outfifo data.

DMA_INFIFO_CNT.description: The remains of SPI dma infifo data.

BUF0.description: 32 bits data buffer 0, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF1.description: 32 bits data buffer 1, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF2.description: 32 bits data buffer 2, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF3.description: 32 bits data buffer 3, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF4.description: 32 bits data buffer 4, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF5.description: 32 bits data buffer 5, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF6.description: 32 bits data buffer 6, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF7.description: 32 bits data buffer 7, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF8.description: 32 bits data buffer 8, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF9.description: 32 bits data buffer 9, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF10.description: 32 bits data buffer 10, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF11.description: 32 bits data buffer 11, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF12.description: 32 bits data buffer 12, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF13.description: 32 bits data buffer 13, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF14.description: 32 bits data buffer 14, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF15.description: 32 bits data buffer 15, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF16.description: 32 bits data buffer 16, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

BUF17.description: 32 bits data buffer 17, transferred in the unit of byte. Byte addressable in slave half-duplex mode.

DIN0_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN1_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN2_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN3_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN4_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN5_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN6_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN7_MODE.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: input without delayed, 1: input with the posedge of clk_apb,2 input with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: input with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

TIMING_CLK_ENA.description: 1:enable hclk in spi_timing.v.  0: disable it. Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN0_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN1_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN2_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN3_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN4_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN5_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN6_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DIN7_NUM.description: the input signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,...  Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT0_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT1_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT2_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT3_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT4_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT5_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT6_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT7_MODE.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT0_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT1_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT2_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT3_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT4_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT5_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT6_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

DOUT7_NUM.description: the output signals are delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_HB_FRONT.description: It is the horizontal blank front porch of a frame. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_VA_HEIGHT.description: It is the vertical active height of a frame. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_VT_HEIGHT.description: It is the vertical total height of a frame. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_MODE_EN.description: 1: Enable LCD mode output vsync, hsync, de. 0: Disable. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_VB_FRONT.description: It is the vertical blank front porch of a frame. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_HA_WIDTH.description: It is the horizontal active width of a frame. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_HT_WIDTH.description: It is the horizontal total width of a frame. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_VSYNC_WIDTH.description: It is the position of spi_vsync active pulse in a line. Can be configured in CONF state.

VSYNC_IDLE_POL.description: It is the idle value of spi_vsync. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_HSYNC_WIDTH.description: It is the position of spi_hsync active pulse in a line. Can be configured in CONF state.

HSYNC_IDLE_POL.description: It is the idle value of spi_hsync. Can be configured in CONF state.

LCD_HSYNC_POSITION.description: It is the position of spi_hsync active pulse in a line. Can be configured in CONF state.

D_DQS_MODE.description: the output spi_dqs is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

D_CD_MODE.description: the output spi_cd is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

D_DE_MODE.description: the output spi_de is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

D_HSYNC_MODE.description: the output spi_hsync is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

D_VSYNC_MODE.description: the output spi_vsync is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: output without delayed, 1: output with the posedge of clk_apb,2 output with the negedge of clk_apb, 3: output with the spi_clk. Can be configured in CONF state.

DE_IDLE_POL.description: It is the idle value of spi_de.

HS_BLANK_EN.description: 1: The pulse of spi_hsync is out in vertical blanking lines in seg-trans or one trans. 0: spi_hsync pulse is valid only in active region lines in seg-trans.

D_DQS_NUM.description: the output spi_dqs is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

D_CD_NUM.description: the output spi_cd is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

D_DE_NUM.description: the output spi_de is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

D_HSYNC_NUM.description: the output spi_hsync is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

D_VSYNC_NUM.description: the output spi_vsync is delayed by system clock cycles, 0: delayed by 1 cycle, 1: delayed by 2 cycles,... Can be configured in CONF state.

PERIP_CLK_EN0.description: System peripheral clock (for hardware accelerators) enable register

PERIP_CLK_EN1.description: System peripheral clock  (for hardware accelerators) enable register 1

LPCK_DIV_INT.description: Low power clock divider integer register

BT_LPCK_DIV_FRAC.description: Divider fraction configuration register for low-power clock

EXTERNAL_DEVICE_ENCRYPT_DECRYPT_CONTROL.description: External memory encrypt and decrypt controlling register

RTC_FASTMEM_CRC.description: RTC fast memory CRC controlling register

ROM_FO.description: This field is used to force on clock gate of internal ROM.

ROM_FORCE_PD.description: This field is used to power down internal ROM.

ROM_FORCE_PU.description: This field is used to power up internal ROM.

SRAM_FO.description: This field is used to force on clock gate of internal SRAM.

SRAM_FORCE_PD.description: This field is used to power down internal SRAM.

CLK_EN_DEDICATED_GPIO.description: Set this bit to enable clock of DEDICATED GPIO module.

RST_EN_DEDICATED_GPIO.description: Set this bit to reset DEDICATED GPIO module.

CPUPERIOD_SEL.description: This field is used to select the clock frequency of CPU or CPU period.

PLL_FREQ_SEL.description: This field is used to select the PLL clock frequency based on CPU period.

CPU_WAIT_MODE_FORCE_ON.description: Set this bit to force on CPU wait mode. In this mode, the clock gate of CPU is turned off until any interrupts happen. This mode could also be force on via WAITI instruction.

CPU_WAITI_DELAY_NUM.description: Sets the number of delay cycles to enter CPU wait mode after a WAITI instruction.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_0.description: Stores the 0 to 31 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_1.description: Stores the 32 to 63 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_2.description: Stores the 64 to 95 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_3.description: Stores the 96 to 127 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_4.description: Stores the 128 to 159 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_5.description: Stores the 160 to 191 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_6.description: Stores the 192 to 223 bits of the 256 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

CANCEL_EFUSE_DISABLE_JTAG_TEMPORARY_7.description: Stores the 0 to 224 bits of the 255 bits register used to cancel the temporary disable of eFuse to JTAG.

LSLP_MEM_PD_MASK.description: Set this bit to allow the memory to work as usual when the chip enters the light-sleep state.

TIMERS_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of timers.

SPI01_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of SPI0 and SPI1.

UART_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of UART0.

UHCI1_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of UHCI1.

UART_MEM_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of UART memory.

PWM2_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of PWM2.

PWM3_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of PWM3.

SPI3_DMA_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of SPI3 DMA.

APB_SARADC_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of SAR ADC.

SYSTIMER_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of system timer.

ADC2_ARB_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of aribiter of ADC2.

SPI4_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of SPI4.

CRYPTO_AES_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of cryptography AES.

CRYPTO_SHA_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of cryptography SHA.

CRYPTO_RSA_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of cryptography RSA.

CRYPTO_DS_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of cryptography Digital Signature.

CRYPTO_HMAC_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of cryptography HMAC.

CRYPTO_DMA_CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of cryptography DMA.

TIMERS_RST.description: Set this bit to reset timers.

SPI01_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SPI0 and SPI1.

UART_RST.description: Set this bit to reset UART0.

WDG_RST.description: Set this bit to reset WDG.

I2S0_RST.description: Set this bit to reset I2S0.

UART1_RST.description: Set this bit to reset UART1.

SPI2_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SPI2.

I2C_EXT0_RST.description: Set this bit to reset I2C EXT0.

UHCI0_RST.description: Set this bit to reset UHCI0.

RMT_RST.description: Set this bit to reset remote controller.

PCNT_RST.description: Set this bit to reset pulse count.

LEDC_RST.description: Set this bit to reset LED PWM.

UHCI1_RST.description: Set this bit to reset UHCI1.

TIMERGROUP_RST.description: Set this bit to reset timer group0.

EFUSE_RST.description: Set this bit to reset eFuse.
