SPI3_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SPI3.

PWM0_RST.description: Set this bit to reset PWM0.

I2C_EXT1_RST.description: Set this bit to reset I2C EXT1.

TWAI_RST.description: Set this bit to reset CAN.

PWM1_RST.description: Set this bit to reset PWM1.

I2S1_RST.description: Set this bit to reset I2S1.

SPI2_DMA_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SPI2 DMA.

USB_RST.description: Set this bit to reset USB.

UART_MEM_RST.description: Set this bit to reset UART memory.

PWM2_RST.description: Set this bit to reset PWM2.

PWM3_RST.description: Set this bit to reset PWM3.

SPI3_DMA_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SPI3 DMA.

APB_SARADC_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SAR ADC.

SYSTIMER_RST.description: Set this bit to reset system timer.

ADC2_ARB_RST.description: Set this bit to reset aribiter of ADC2.

SPI4_RST.description: Set this bit to reset SPI4.

CRYPTO_AES_RST.description: Set this bit to reset cryptography AES.

CRYPTO_SHA_RST.description: Set this bit to reset cryptography SHA.

CRYPTO_RSA_RST.description: Set this bit to reset cryptography RSA.

CRYPTO_DS_RST.description: Set this bit to reset cryptography digital signature.

CRYPTO_HMAC_RST.description: Set this bit to reset cryptography HMAC.

CRYPTO_DMA_RST.description: Set this bit to reset cryptography DMA.

LPCK_DIV_NUM.description: This field is used to set the integer number of the divider value.

LPCLK_SEL_RTC_SLOW.description: Set this bit to select RTC slow clock as the low power clock.

LPCLK_SEL_8M.description: Set this bit to select 8m clock as the low power clock.

LPCLK_SEL_XTAL.description: Set this bit to select xtal clock as the low power clock.

LPCLK_SEL_XTAL32K.description: Set this bit to select xtal32k clock as the low power clock.

LPCLK_RTC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable the RTC low power clock.

CPU_INTR_FROM_CPU_0.description: Set this bit to generate CPU interrupt 0. This bit needs to be reset by software in the ISR process.

CPU_INTR_FROM_CPU_1.description: Set this bit to generate CPU interrupt 1. This bit needs to be reset by software in the ISR process.

CPU_INTR_FROM_CPU_2.description: Set this bit to generate CPU interrupt 2. This bit needs to be reset by software in the ISR process.

CPU_INTR_FROM_CPU_3.description: Set this bit to generate CPU interrupt 3. This bit needs to be reset by software in the ISR process.

RSA_MEM_PD.description: Set this bit to power down RSA memory. This bit has the lowest priority. When Digital Signature occupies the RSA, this bit is invalid.

RSA_MEM_FORCE_PU.description: Set this bit to force power up RSA memory. This bit has the second highest priority.

RSA_MEM_FORCE_PD.description: Set this bit to force power down RSA memory. This bit has the highest priority.

BUSTOEXTMEM_ENA.description: Set this bit to enable bus to EDMA.

PRO_ICACHE_CLK_ON.description: Set this bit to enable clock of i-cache.

PRO_DCACHE_CLK_ON.description: Set this bit to enable clock of d-cache.

PRO_CACHE_RESET.description: Set this bit to reset cache.

ENABLE_SPI_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: Set this bit to enable Manual Encryption under SPI Boot mode.

ENABLE_DOWNLOAD_DB_ENCRYPT.description: Set this bit to enable Auto Encryption under Download Boot mode.

ENABLE_DOWNLOAD_G0CB_DECRYPT.description: Set this bit to enable Auto Decryption under Download Boot mode.

ENABLE_DOWNLOAD_MANUAL_ENCRYPT.description: Set this bit to enable Manual Encryption under Download Boot mode.

RTC_MEM_CRC_START.description: Set this bit to start the CRC of RTC memory.

RTC_MEM_CRC_ADDR.description: This field is used to set address of RTC memory for CRC.

RTC_MEM_CRC_LEN.description: This field is used to set length of RTC memory for CRC based on start address.

RTC_MEM_CRC_FINISH.description: This bit stores the status of RTC memory CRC. High level means finished while low level means not finished.

RTC_MEM_CRC_RES.description: This field stores the CRC result of RTC memory.

REDUNDANT_ECO_DRIVE.description: The redundant ECO drive bit to avoid optimization in circuits.

REDUNDANT_ECO_RESULT.description: The redundant ECO result bit to avoid optimization in circuits.

CLK_EN.description: Set this bit to enable clock of this module.

SRAM_FORCE_PU.description: This field is used to power up internal SRAM.

PRE_DIV_CNT.description: This field is used to set the count of prescaler of XTAL\_CLK.

SOC_CLK_SEL.description: This field is used to select SOC clock.

CLK_XTAL_FREQ.description: This field is used to read XTAL frequency in MHz.

LOAD_HI.description: High 32 bits to be loaded to system timer

LOAD_LO.description: Low 32 bits to be loaded to system timer

TARGET0_CONF.description: Configure work mode for system timer target 0

TARGET1_CONF.description: Configure work mode for system timer target 1

TARGET2_CONF.description: Configure work mode for system timer target 2

TIMER_LOAD.description:
Set this bit to 1, the value stored in SYSTIMER_TIMER_LOAD_HI and in
SYSTIMER_TIMER_LOAD_LO will be loaded to system timer

TIMER_LOAD_HI.description: The value to be loaded into system timer, high 32 bits.

TIMER_LOAD_LO.description: The value to be loaded into system timer, low 32 bits.

TIMER_XTAL_STEP.description: Set system timer increment step when using XTAL_CLK.

TIMER_PLL_STEP.description: Set system timer increment step when using PLL_CLK

TARGET0_PERIOD.description:
Set alarm period for system timer target 0, only valid in periodic
alarms mode.

TARGET0_PERIOD_MODE.description: Set work mode for system timer target 0. 0: work in a timedelay alarm mode; 1: work in periodic alarms mode.

TARGET1_PERIOD.description:
Set alarm period for system timer target 1, only valid in periodic
alarms mode.

TARGET1_PERIOD_MODE.description: Set work mode for system timer target 1. 0: work in a timedelay alarm mode; 1: work in periodic alarms mode.

TARGET2_PERIOD.description:
Set alarm period for system timer target 2, only valid in periodic
alarms mode.

TARGET2_PERIOD_MODE.description: Set work mode for system timer target 2. 0: work in a timedelay alarm mode; 1: work in periodic alarms mode.

TIMER_UNIT0_VALUE_VALID.description:
Check if it is valid to read out timer value from registers. 0: Not
ready to read timer value from registers; 1: Ready to read timer value from registers

TIMER_UNIT0_UPDATE.description: Update system timer value to registers.

TARGET0_INT_ENA.description: Interrupt enable bit of system timer target 0.

TARGET1_INT_ENA.description: Interrupt enable bit of system timer target 1.

TARGET2_INT_ENA.description: Interrupt enable bit of system timer target 2.

INT0_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit of system timer target 0.

INT1_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit of system timer target 1.

INT2_RAW.description: Interrupt raw bit of system timer target 2.

TARGET0_INT_CLR.description: Interrupt clear bit of system timer target 0.

TARGET1_INT_CLR.description: Interrupt clear bit of system timer target 1.

TARGET2_INT_CLR.description: Interrupt clear bit of system timer target 2.

RESET_MODE.description: This bit is used to configure the operating mode of the TWAI Controller. 1: Reset mode; 0: Operating mode.

LISTEN_ONLY_MODE.description: 1: Listen only mode. In this mode the nodes will only receive messages from the bus, without generating the acknowledge signal nor updating the RX error counter.

SELF_TEST_MODE.description: 1: Self test mode. In this mode the TX nodes can perform a successful transmission without receiving the acknowledge signal. This mode is often used to test a single node with the self reception request command.

RX_FILTER_MODE.description: This bit is used to configure the filter mode. 0: Dual filter mode; 1: Single filter mode.

TX_REQ.description: Set the bit to 1 to allow the driving nodes start transmission.

ABORT_TX.description: Set the bit to 1 to cancel a pending transmission request.

RELEASE_BUF.description: Set the bit to 1 to release the RX buffer.

CLR_OVERRUN.description: Set the bit to 1 to clear the data overrun status bit.

SELF_RX_REQ.description: Self reception request command. Set the bit to 1 to allow a message be transmitted and received simultaneously.

RX_BUF_ST.description: 1: The data in the RX buffer is not empty, with at least one received data packet.

OVERRUN_ST.description: 1: The RX FIFO is full and data overrun has occurred.

TX_BUF_ST.description: 1: The TX buffer is empty, the CPU may write a message into it.

TX_COMPLETE.description: 1: The TWAI controller has successfully received a packet from the bus.

RX_ST.description: 1: The TWAI Controller is receiving a message from the bus.

TX_ST.description: 1: The TWAI Controller is transmitting a message to the bus.

ERR_ST.description: 1: At least one of the RX/TX error counter has reached or exceeded the value set in register TWAI_ERR_WARNING_LIMIT_REG.

BUS_OFF_ST.description: 1: In bus-off status, the TWAI Controller is no longer involved in bus activities.

MISS_ST.description: This bit reflects whether the data packet in the RX FIFO is complete. 1: The current packet is missing; 0: The current packet is complete

RX_INT_ST.description: Receive interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates there are messages to be handled in the RX FIFO.

TX_INT_ST.description: Transmit interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the message transmitting mis- sion is finished and a new transmission is able to execute.

ERR_WARN_INT_ST.description: Error warning interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the error status signal and the bus-off status signal of Status register have changed (e.g., switched from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0).

OVERRUN_INT_ST.description: Data overrun interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates a data overrun interrupt is generated in the RX FIFO.

ERR_PASSIVE_INT_ST.description: Error passive interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates the TWAI Controller is switched between error active status and error passive status due to the change of error counters.

ARB_LOST_INT_ST.description: Arbitration lost interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates an arbitration lost interrupt is generated.

BUS_ERR_INT_ST.description: Error interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, it indicates an error is detected on the bus.

RX_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable receive interrupt.

TX_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable transmit interrupt.

ERR_WARN_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error warning interrupt.

OVERRUN_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable data overrun interrupt.

ERR_PASSIVE_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error passive interrupt.

ARB_LOST_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable arbitration lost interrupt.

BUS_ERR_INT_ENA.description: Set this bit to 1 to enable error interrupt.

BAUD_PRESC.description: Baud Rate Prescaler, determines the frequency dividing ratio.

TIME_SAMP.description: The number of sample points. 0: the bus is sampled once; 1: the bus is sampled three times

ARB_LOST_CAP.description: This register contains information about the bit position of lost arbitration.

ECC_SEGMENT.description: This register contains information about the location of errors, see Table 181 for details.

ECC_DIRECTION.description: This register contains information about transmission direction of the node when error occurs. 1: Error occurs when receiving a message; 0: Error occurs when transmitting a message

ECC_TYPE.description: This register contains information about error types: 00: bit error; 01: form error; 10: stuff error; 11: other type of error

ERR_WARNING_LIMIT.description: Error warning threshold. In the case when any of a error counter value exceeds the threshold, or all the error counter values are below the threshold, an error warning interrupt will be triggered (given the enable signal is valid).

RX_ERR_CNT.description: The RX error counter register, reflects value changes under reception status.

TX_ERR_CNT.description: The TX error counter register, reflects value changes under transmission status.

TX_BYTE_0.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 0 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 0th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_1.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 1 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 1st byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_2.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 2 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 2nd byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_3.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance code register 3 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 3rd byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_4.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 0 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 4th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_5.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 1 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 5th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_6.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 2 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 6th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_7.description: In reset mode, it is acceptance mask register 3 with R/W Permission. In operation mode, it stores the 7th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_8.description: Stored the 8th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_9.description: Stored the 9th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_10.description: Stored the 10th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_11.description: Stored the 11th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

TX_BYTE_12.description: Stored the 12th byte information of the data to be transmitted under operating mode.

RX_MESSAGE_COUNTER.description: This register reflects the number of messages available within the RX FIFO.

CD.description: These bits are used to configure frequency dividing coefficients of the external CLKOUT pin.

CLOCK_OFF.description: This bit can be configured under reset mode. 1: Disable the external CLKOUT pin; 0: Enable the external CLKOUT pin

LOWPULSE.description: Autobaud minimum low pulse duration register

HIGHPULSE.description: Autobaud minimum high pulse duration register

MEM_TX_STATUS.description: TX FIFO write and read offset address

MEM_RX_STATUS.description: RX FIFO write and read offset address

RXFIFO_RD_BYTE.description: UART 0 accesses FIFO via this register.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver receives more data than what UART_RXFIFO_FULL_THRHD specifies.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the amount of data in TX FIFO is less than what UART_TXFIFO_EMPTY_THRHD specifies.

PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects a parity error in the data.

FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects a data frame error.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver receives more data than the capacity of RX FIFO.

DSR_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects the edge change of DSRn signal.

CTS_CHG_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects the edge change of CTSn signal.

BRK_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects a 0 after the stop bit.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver takes more time than UART_RX_TOUT_THRHD to receive a byte.

SW_XON_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver receives an XON character and UART_SW_FLOW_CON_EN is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver receives an XOFF character and UART_SW_FLOW_CON_EN is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects a glitch in the middle of a start bit.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the transmitter completes  sending  NULL characters, after all data in TX FIFO are sent.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the transmitter has kept the shortest duration after sending the  last data.

TX_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the transmitter has sent out all data in FIFO.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects a parity error from the echo of the transmitter in RS485 mode.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects a data frame error from the echo of the transmitter in RS485 mode.

RS485_CLASH_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when a collision is detected between the transmitter and the receiver in RS485 mode.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when the receiver detects the configured UART_AT_CMD CHAR.

WAKEUP_INT_RAW.description: This interrupt raw bit turns to high level when input RXD edge changes more times than what UART_ACTIVE_THRESHOLD specifies in Light-sleep mode.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_RXFIFO_FULL_INT when UART_RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT when UART_TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ENA is set to 1.

PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_PARITY_ERR_INT when UART_PARITY_ERR_INT_ENA is set to 1.

FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_FRM_ERR_INT when UART_FRM_ERR_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_RXFIFO_OVF_INT when UART_RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

DSR_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_DSR_CHG_INT when UART_DSR_CHG_INT_ENA is set to 1.

CTS_CHG_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_CTS_CHG_INT when UART_CTS_CHG_INT_ENA is set to 1.

BRK_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_BRK_DET_INT when UART_BRK_DET_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_RXFIFO_TOUT_INT when UART_RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ENA is set to 1.

SW_XON_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_SW_XON_INT when UART_SW_XON_INT_ENA is set to 1.

SW_XOFF_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_SW_XOFF_INT when UART_SW_XOFF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_GLITCH_DET_INT when UART_GLITCH_DET_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_TX_BRK_DONE_INT when UART_TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT when UART_TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TX_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_TX_DONE_INT when UART_TX_DONE_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT when UART_RS485_PARITY_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_RS485_FRM_ERR_INT when UART_RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RS485_CLASH_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_RS485_CLASH_INT when UART_RS485_CLASH_INT_ENA is set to 1.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT when UART_AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_ENA is set to 1.

WAKEUP_INT_ST.description: This is the status bit for UART_WAKEUP_INT when UART_WAKEUP_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_RXFIFO_FULL_INT.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT.

PARITY_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_PARITY_ERR_INT.

FRM_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_FRM_ERR_INT.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_RXFIFO_OVF_INT.

DSR_CHG_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_DSR_CHG_INT.

CTS_CHG_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_CTS_CHG_INT.

BRK_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_BRK_DET_INT.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_RXFIFO_TOUT_INT.

SW_XON_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_SW_XON_INT.

SW_XOFF_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_SW_XOFF_INT.

GLITCH_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_GLITCH_DET_INT.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_TX_BRK_DONE_INT.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT.

TX_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_TX_DONE_INT.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT.

RS485_CLASH_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_RS485_CLASH_INT.

AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_AT_CMD_CHAR_DET_INT.

WAKEUP_INT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for UART_WAKEUP_INT.

RXFIFO_FULL_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_THE RXFIFO_FULL_INT interrupt.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT interrupt.

PARITY_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_PARITY_ERR_INT interrupt.

FRM_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_FRM_ERR_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_OVF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_UART_RXFIFO_OVF_INT interrupt.

DSR_CHG_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_DSR_CHG_INT interrupt.

CTS_CHG_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_CTS_CHG_INT interrupt.

BRK_DET_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_BRK_DET_INT interrupt.

RXFIFO_TOUT_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_RXFIFO_TOUT_INT interrupt.

SW_XON_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_SW_XON_INT interrupt.

SW_XOFF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_SW_XOFF_INT interrupt.

GLITCH_DET_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_GLITCH_DET_INT interrupt.

TX_BRK_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_TX_BRK_DONE_INT interrupt.

TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_TX_BRK_IDLE_DONE_INT interrupt.

TX_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_TX_DONE_INT interrupt.

RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_RS485_PARITY_ERR_INT interrupt.

RS485_FRM_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UART_RS485_FRM_ERR_INT interrupt.

CLKDIV.description: The integral part of the frequency divisor.

FRAG.description: The fractional part of the frequency divisor.

EN.description: This is the enable bit for baud rate detection.

GLITCH_FILT.description:
When input pulse width is lower than this value, the pulse is ignored.
This register is used in autobaud detection.

RXFIFO_CNT.description: Stores the number of valid data bytes in RX FIFO.

DSRN.description: This register represents the level of the internal UART DSR signal.

CTSN.description: This register represents the level of the internal UART CTS signal.

RXD.description: This register represents the level of the internal UART RXD signal.

TXFIFO_CNT.description: Stores the number of data bytes in TX FIFO.

DTRN.description: This bit represents the level of the internal UART DTR signal.

RTSN.description: This bit represents the level of the internal UART RTS signal.

TXD.description: This bit represents the level of the internal UART TXD signal.

PARITY.description:
This register is used to configure the parity check mode.
0: even. 1: odd.

PARITY_EN.description: Set this bit to enable UART parity check.

BIT_NUM.description:
This register is used to set the length of data.
0: 5 bits. 1: 6 bits. 2: 7 bits. 3: 8 bits.

STOP_BIT_NUM.description:
This register is used to set the length of  stop bit.
1: 1 bit. 2: 1.5 bits. 3: 2 bits.

SW_RTS.description: This register is used to configure the software RTS signal which is used in software flow control.

SW_DTR.description: This register is used to configure the software DTR signal which is used in software flow control.

TXD_BRK.description: Set this bit to enable the transmitter to send NULL characters when the process of sending data is done.

IRDA_DPLX.description: Set this bit to enable IrDA loopback mode.

IRDA_TX_EN.description: This is the start enable bit for IrDA transmitter.

IRDA_WCTL.description: 1: The IrDA transmitter's 11th bit is the same as 10th bit. 0: Set IrDA transmitter's 11th bit to 0.

IRDA_TX_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of IrDA transmitter.

IRDA_RX_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of IrDA receiver.

LOOPBACK.description: Set this bit to enable UART loopback test mode.

TX_FLOW_EN.description: Set this bit to enable flow control function for the transmitter.

IRDA_EN.description: Set this bit to enable IrDA protocol.

RXFIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset the UART RX FIFO.

TXFIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset the UART TX FIFO.

RXD_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of UART RXD signal.

CTS_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of UART CTS signal.

DSR_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of UART DSR signal.

TXD_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of UART TXD signal.

RTS_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of UART RTS signal.

DTR_INV.description: Set this bit to invert the level of UART DTR signal.

CLK_EN.description: 1: Force clock on for registers. 0: Support clock only when application writes registers.

ERR_WR_MASK.description: 1: The receiver stops storing data into FIFO when data is wrong. 0: The receiver stores the data even if the  received data is wrong.

TICK_REF_ALWAYS_ON.description:
This register is used to select the clock. 
1: APB_CLK. 
0: REF_TICK.

MEM_CLK_EN.description:
The signal to enable UART RAM clock gating.
1: UART RAM powers on, the data of which can be read and written.
0: UART RAM powers down.

RXFIFO_FULL_THRHD.description: An UART_RXFIFO_FULL_INT interrupt is generated when the receiver receives more data than this register’s value.

TXFIFO_EMPTY_THRHD.description: An UART_TXFIFO_EMPTY_INT interrupt is generated when the number of data bytes in TX FIFO is less than this register's value.

RX_TOUT_FLOW_DIS.description: Set this bit to stop accumulating idle_cnt when hardware flow control works.

RX_FLOW_EN.description:
This is the flow enable bit for UART receiver.
1: Choose software flow control with configuring sw_rts signal. 0: Disable software flow control.

RX_TOUT_EN.description: This is the enable bit for UART receiver's timeout function.

MIN_CNT.description: This register stores the value of the minimum duration time of the low level pulse. It is used in baud rate detection.
This register stores  the value of the maximum duration time for the high level pulse. It is used in baud rate detection.

RXD_EDGE_CNT.description: This register stores the count of RXD edge change.  It is used in baud rate detection. As baud rate registers UART_REG_LOWPULSE_MIN_CNT, UART_REG_HIGHPULSE_MIN_CNT, UART_REG_POSEDGE_MIN_CNT, and UART_REG_NEGEDGE_MIN_CNT always record the minimal value, UART_REG_RXD_EDGE_CNT indicates the statistic number of RXD edge to find out the minimal value for these baud rate registers.

SW_FLOW_CON_EN.description: Set this bit to enable software flow control. When UART receives flow control characters XON or XOFF, which can be configured by UART_XON_CHAR or UART_XOFF_CHAR respectively, UART_SW_XON_INT or UART_SW_XOFF_INT interrupts can be triggered if enabled.

XONOFF_DEL.description: Set this bit to remove flow control characters from the received data.

FORCE_XON.description: Set this bit to force the transmitter to send data.

FORCE_XOFF.description: Set this bit to stop the transmitter from sending data.

SEND_XON.description: Set this bit to send an XON character. This bit is cleared by hardware automatically.

SEND_XOFF.description: Set this bit to send an XOFF character. This bit is cleared by hardware automatically.

ACTIVE_THRESHOLD.description: The UART is activated from Light-sleep mode when the input RXD edge changes more times than this register's value.

XOFF_THRESHOLD.description: When the number of data bytes in RX FIFO is more than this register's value with UART_SW_FLOW_CON_EN set to 1, the transmitter sends an XOFF character.

XOFF_CHAR.description: This register stores the XOFF flow control character.

XON_THRESHOLD.description: When the number of data bytes in RX FIFO is less than this register's value with UART_SW_FLOW_CON_EN set to 1, the transmitter sends an XON character.

XON_CHAR.description: This register stores the XON flow control character.

RX_IDLE_THRHD.description: A frame end signal is generated when the receiver takes more time to receive one byte data than this register's value, in the unit of bit time (the time it takes to transfer one bit).

TX_IDLE_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the duration time between transfers, in the unit of bit time (the time it takes to transfer one bit).

TX_BRK_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the number of 0 to be sent after the process of sending data is done. It is active when UART_TXD_BRK is set to 1.

RS485_EN.description: Set this bit to choose RS485 mode.

DL0_EN.description: Set this bit to delay the stop bit by 1 bit.

DL1_EN.description: Set this bit to delay the stop bit by 1 bit.

RS485TX_RX_EN.description: Set this bit to enable the receiver could receive data when the transmitter is transmitting data in RS485 mode.

RS485RXBY_TX_EN.description:
1: enable RS485 transmitter to send data when RS485 receiver line is busy. 
0: RS485 transmitter should not send data when its receiver is busy.

RS485_RX_DLY_NUM.description: This register is used to delay the receiver's internal data signal.

RS485_TX_DLY_NUM.description: This register is used to delay the transmitter's internal data signal.

PRE_IDLE_NUM.description:
This register is used to configure the idle duration time before the first AT_CMD is received by the receiver. 
It will not take the next data received as AT_CMD character when the duration is less than this register's value.

POST_IDLE_NUM.description:
This register is used to configure the duration time between the last AT_CMD and the next data.
It will not take the previous data as AT_CMD character when the duration is less than this register's value.

RX_GAP_TOUT.description:
This register is used to configure the duration time between the AT_CMD characters.
It will not take the data as continuous AT_CMD characters when the duration time is less than this register's value.

AT_CMD_CHAR.description: This register is used to configure the content of AT_CMD character.

CHAR_NUM.description: This register is used to configure the number of continuous AT_CMD characters received by the receiver.

RX_SIZE.description: This register is used to configure the amount of RAM allocated for RX FIFO. The default number is 128 bytes.

TX_SIZE.description: This register is used to configure the amount of RAM allocated for TX FIFO. The default number is 128 bytes.

RX_FLOW_THRHD.description: This register is used to configure the maximum amount of data bytes that can be received  when hardware flow control works.

RX_TOUT_THRHD.description:
This register is used to configure the threshold time that the receiver takes to receive one byte, in the unit of bit time (the time it takes to transfer one bit).
The UART_RXFIFO_TOUT_INT interrupt will be triggered when the receiver takes more time to receive one byte with UART RX_TOUT_EN set to 1.

MEM_FORCE_PD.description: Set this bit to force power down UART RAM.

MEM_FORCE_PU.description: Set this bit to force power up UART RAM.

APB_TX_WADDR.description: This register stores the offset address in TX FIFO when software writes TX FIFO via APB.

TX_RADDR.description: This register stores the offset address in TX FIFO when TX FSM reads data via Tx_FIFO_Ctrl.

APB_RX_RADDR.description: This register stores the offset address in RX_FIFO when software reads data from RX FIFO via APB.

RX_WADDR.description: This register stores the offset address in RX FIFO when Rx_FIFO_Ctrl writes RX FIFO.

ST_URX_OUT.description: This is the status register of the receiver.

ST_UTX_OUT.description: This is the status register of the transmitter.

POSEDGE_MIN_CNT.description: This register stores the minimal input clock count between two positive edges. It is used in baud rate detection.

NEGEDGE_MIN_CNT.description: This register stores the minimal input clock count between two negative edges. It is used in baud rate detection.

DATE.description: This is the version control register.

ID.description: This register is used to configure the UART_ID.

DMA_OUT_PUSH.description: Push control register of TX FIFO

DMA_IN_POP.description: Pop control register of RX FIFO

DMA_OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: Outlink descriptor address when EOF occurs

DMA_IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: Inlink descriptor address when EOF occurs

DMA_IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: Inlink descriptor address when errors occur

DMA_OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: Outlink descriptor address before the last transmit descriptor

DMA_IN_DSCR.description: The third word of the next receive descriptor

DMA_IN_DSCR_BF0.description: The third word of current receive descriptor

DMA_OUT_DSCR.description: The third word of the next transmit descriptor

DMA_OUT_DSCR_BF0.description: The third word of current transmit descriptor

IN_RST.description: Set this bit to reset in DMA FSM.

OUT_RST.description: Set this bit to reset out DMA FSM.

AHBM_FIFO_RST.description: Set this bit to reset AHB interface cmdFIFO of DMA.

AHBM_RST.description: Set this bit to reset AHB interface of DMA.

OUT_AUTO_WRBACK.description: Set this bit to enable automatic outlink writeback when all the data in TX FIFO has been transmitted.

OUT_EOF_MODE.description:
This register is used to specify the generation mode of UHCI_OUT_EOF_INT interrupt. 
1: When DMA has popped all data from FIFO.
0: When AHB has pushed all data to FIFO.

UART0_CE.description: Set this bit to link up UHCI and UART0.

UART1_CE.description: Set this bit to link up UHCI and UART1.

OUTDSCR_BURST_EN.description:
This register is used to specify DMA transmit descriptor transfer mode.
1: burst mode.
0: byte mode.

INDSCR_BURST_EN.description:
This register is used to specify DMA receive descriptor transfer mode.
1: burst mode.
0: byte mode.

MEM_TRANS_EN.description: 1: UHCI transmitted data would be write back into DMA INFIFO.

SEPER_EN.description: Set this bit to separate the data frame using a special character.

HEAD_EN.description: Set this bit to encode the data packet with a formatting header.

CRC_REC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable UHCI to receive the 16 bit CRC.

UART_IDLE_EOF_EN.description: If this bit is set to 1, UHCI will end the payload receiving process when UART has been in idle state.

LEN_EOF_EN.description:
If this bit is set to 1, UHCI decoder stops receiving payload data when the number of received data bytes has reached the specified value. 
The value is payload length indicated by UCHI packet header when UHCI_HEAD_EN is 1 or the value is a configuration value when UHCI_HEAD_EN is 0. 
If this bit is set to 0, UHCI decoder stops receiving payload data  upon receiving 0xC0.

ENCODE_CRC_EN.description: Set this bit to enable data integrity checking by appending a 16 bit CCITT-CRC to the end of the payload.

CLK_EN.description: 1: Force clock on for registers. 0: Support clock only when application writes registers.

UART_RX_BRK_EOF_EN.description: If this bit is set to 1, UHCI stops receiving payload data when a NULL frame is received by UART.

RX_START_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_RX_START_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when a separator has been sent.

TX_START_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_TX_START_INT  interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when DMA detects a separator.

RX_HUNG_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_RX_HUNG_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when DMA takes more time to receive data than the configure value.

TX_HUNG_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_TX_HUNG_INT  interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when DMA takes more time to read data from RAM than the configured value.

IN_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_IN_DONE_INT  interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when an receive descriptor is completed.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when a data packet has been received successfully.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_IN_ERR_EOF_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when there are some errors in EOF in the receive descriptor.

OUT_DONE_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_OUT_DONE_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when an transmit descriptor is completed.

OUT_EOF_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_OUT_EOF_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when the current descriptor's EOF bit is 1.

IN_DSCR_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_IN_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when there are some errors in the receive descriptor.

OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when there are some errors in the transmit descriptor.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when there are not enough inlinks for DMA.

OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when there are some errors in EOF in the transmit descriptor.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when all data in the last buffer address has been sent out.

SEND_S_REG_Q_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_SEND_S_REG_Q_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when DMA has sent out a short packet using single_send mode.

SEND_A_REG_Q_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_SEND_A_REG_Q_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when DMA has sent out a short packet using always_send mode.

DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT_RAW.description: This is the interrupt raw bit for UHCI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT interrupt. The interrupt is triggered when the number of data bytes in DMA RX FIFO has reached the configured threshold value.

RX_START_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_RX_START_INT interrupt when UHCI_RX_START_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TX_START_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_TX_START_INT interrupt when UHCI_TX_START_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RX_HUNG_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_RX_HUNG_INT interrupt when UHCI_RX_HUNG_INT_ENA is set to 1.

TX_HUNG_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_TX_HUNG_INT interrupt when UHCI_TX_HUNG_INT_ENA is set to 1.

IN_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_IN_DONE_INT interrupt when UHCI_IN_DONE_INT_ENA is set to 1.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT interrupt when UHCI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_IN_ERR_EOF_INT interrupt when UHCI_IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OUT_DONE_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_OUT_DONE_INT interrupt when UHCI_OUT_DONE_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OUT_EOF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_OUT_EOF_INT interrupt when UHCI_OUT_EOF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

IN_DSCR_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_IN_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt when UHCI_IN_DSCR_ERR_INT is set to 1.

OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt when UHCI_OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_ENA is set to 1.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT interrupt when UHCI_IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for  UHCI_OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT interrupt when UHCI_OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT_ENA is set to 1.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for  UHCI_OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT interrupt when UHCI_OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ENA is set to 1.

SEND_S_REG_Q_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for  UHCI_SEND_S_REG_Q_INT interrupt when UHCI_SEND_S_REG_Q_INT_ENA is set to 1.

SEND_A_REG_Q_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_SEND_A_REG_Q_INT interrupt when UHCI_SEND_A_REG_Q_INT_ENA is set to 1.

DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT_ST.description: This is the masked interrupt bit for UHCI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT INTERRUPT when UHCI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT_ENA is set to 1.

RX_START_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_RX_START_INT interrupt.

TX_START_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_TX_START_INT interrupt.

RX_HUNG_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_RX_HUNG_INT interrupt.

TX_HUNG_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_TX_HUNG_INT interrupt.

IN_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_IN_DONE_INT interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT interrupt.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_IN_ERR_EOF_INT interrupt.

OUT_DONE_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_OUT_DONE_INT interrupt.

OUT_EOF_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_OUT_EOF_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_IN_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT interrupt.

OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT interrupt.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT interrupt.

SEND_S_REG_Q_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_SEND_S_REG_Q_INT interrupt.

SEND_A_REG_Q_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_SEND_A_REG_Q_INT interrupt.

DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT_ENA.description: This is the interrupt enable bit for UHCI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT interrupt.

RX_START_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_RX_START_INT interrupt.

TX_START_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_TX_START_INT interrupt.

RX_HUNG_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_RX_HUNG_INT interrupt.

TX_HUNG_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_TX_HUNG_INT interrupt.

IN_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_IN_DONE_INT interrupt.

IN_SUC_EOF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_IN_SUC_EOF_INT interrupt.

IN_ERR_EOF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_IN_ERR_EOF_INT interrupt.

OUT_DONE_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_OUT_DONE_INT interrupt.

OUT_EOF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_OUT_EOF_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_IN_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt.

OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_OUT_DSCR_ERR_INT interrupt.

IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_IN_DSCR_EMPTY_INT interrupt.

OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_OUTLINK_EOF_ERR_INT interrupt.

OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_OUT_TOTAL_EOF_INT interrupt.

SEND_S_REG_Q_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_SEND_S_REG_Q_INT interrupt.

SEND_A_REG_Q_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_SEND_A_REG_Q_INT interrupt.

DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT_CLR.description: Set this bit to clear UHCI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT interrupt.

OUTFIFO_WDATA.description: This is the data that need to be pushed into TX FIFO.

OUTFIFO_PUSH.description: Set this bit to push data into TX FIFO.

INFIFO_RDATA.description: This register stores the data popping from RX FIFO.

INFIFO_POP.description: Set this bit to pop data from  RX FIFO.

OUTLINK_ADDR.description: This register is used to specify the least significant 20 bits of the first transmit descriptor's address.

OUTLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the transmit descriptor.

OUTLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start a new transmit descriptor.

OUTLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart the transmit descriptor from the last address.

OUTLINK_PARK.description:
1: the transmit descriptor's FSM is in idle state.
0: the transmit descriptor's FSM is working.

INLINK_ADDR.description: This register is used to specify the least significant 20 bits of the first receive descriptor's address.

INLINK_AUTO_RET.description: This is the enable bit to return to current receive descriptor's address, when there are some errors in current packet.

INLINK_STOP.description: Set this bit to stop dealing with the receive descriptors.

INLINK_START.description: Set this bit to start dealing with the receive descriptors.

INLINK_RESTART.description: Set this bit to restart new receive descriptors.

INLINK_PARK.description:
1: the receive descriptor's FSM is in idle state.
0: the receive descriptor's FSM is working.

CHECK_SUM_EN.description: This is the enable bit to check header checksum when UHCI receives a data packet.

CHECK_SEQ_EN.description: This is the enable bit to check sequence number when UHCI receives a data packet.

CRC_DISABLE.description: Set this bit to support CRC calculation. Data Integrity check present bit in UHCI packet frame should be 1.

SAVE_HEAD.description: Set this bit to save the packet header when UHCI receives a data packet.

TX_CHECK_SUM_RE.description: Set this bit to encode the data packet with a checksum.

TX_ACK_NUM_RE.description: Set this bit to encode the data packet with an acknowledgement when a reliable packet is to be transmit.

CHECK_OWNER.description: 1: Check the link list descriptor when link list owner is DMA controller; 0: Always check link list descriptor.

WAIT_SW_START.description: The UHCI encoder will jump to ST_SW_WAIT status if this register is set to 1.

SW_START.description: If current UHCI_ENCODE_STATE is ST_SW_WAIT, the UHCI will start to send data packet out when this bit is set to 1.

DMA_INFIFO_FULL_THRS.description: This field is used to generate the UHCI_DMA_INFIFO_FULL_WM_INT interrupt when the counter value of DMA RX FIFO exceeds the value of the register.

INLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current receive descriptor's address.

INFIFO_CNT_DEBUG.description: This register stores the number of data bytes in RX FIFO.

OUTLINK_DSCR_ADDR.description: This register stores the current transmit descriptor's address.

OUTFIFO_CNT.description: This register stores the number of data bytes in TX FIFO.

OUT_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the transmit descriptor when the EOF bit in this descriptor is 1.

IN_SUC_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the receive descriptor when received successful EOF.

IN_ERR_EOF_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the receive descriptor when there are some errors in this descriptor.

OUT_EOF_BFR_DES_ADDR.description: This register stores the address of the transmit descriptor before the last transmit descriptor.

INLINK_DSCR.description: This register stores the third word of the next receive descriptor.

INLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: This register stores the third word of the current receive descriptor.

OUTLINK_DSCR.description: This register stores the third word of the next transmit descriptor.

OUTLINK_DSCR_BF0.description: This register stores the third word of the current transmit descriptor.

TX_C0_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to decode character 0xC0 when DMA receives data.

TX_DB_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to decode character 0xDB when DMA receives data.

TX_11_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to decode flow control character 0x11 when DMA receives data.

TX_13_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to decode flow control character 0x13 when DMA receives data.

RX_C0_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to replace 0xC0 by special characters when DMA sends data.

RX_DB_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to replace 0xDB by special characters when DMA sends data.

RX_11_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to replace flow control character 0x11 by special characters when DMA sends data.

RX_13_ESC_EN.description: Set this bit to replace flow control character 0x13 by special characters when DMA sends data.

TXFIFO_TIMEOUT.description: This register stores the timeout value. UHCI produce the UHCI_TX_HUNG_INT interrupt when DMA takes more time to receive data.

TXFIFO_TIMEOUT_SHIFT.description: This register is used to configure the maximum tick count.

TXFIFO_TIMEOUT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for TX FIFO receive timeout.

RXFIFO_TIMEOUT.description: This register stores the timeout value. UHCI produce the UHCI_RX_HUNG_INT interrupt when DMA takes more time to read data from RAM.

RXFIFO_TIMEOUT_SHIFT.description: This register is used to configure the maximum tick count.

RXFIFO_TIMEOUT_ENA.description: This is the enable bit for DMA send timeout.

RX_HEAD.description: This register stores the header of the current received packet.

SINGLE_SEND_NUM.description: This register is used to specify the single_send mode.

SINGLE_SEND_EN.description: Set this bit to enable single_send mode to send short packets.

ALWAYS_SEND_NUM.description: This register is used to specify the always_send mode.

ALWAYS_SEND_EN.description: Set this bit to enable always_send mode to send short packets.

SEND_Q0_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q0_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q1_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q1_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q2_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q2_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q3_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q3_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q4_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q4_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q5_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q5_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q6_WORD0.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEND_Q6_WORD1.description: This register is used as a quick_sent register when mode is specified by UHCI_ALWAYS_SEND_NUM or UHCI_SINGLE_SEND_NUM.

SEPER_CHAR.description: This register is used to define separators to encode data packets. The default value is 0xC0.

SEPER_ESC_CHAR0.description: This register is used to define the first character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDB.

SEPER_ESC_CHAR1.description: This register is used to define the second character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDC.

ESC_SEQ0.description: This register is used to define a character that need to be encoded. The default value is 0xDB that used as the first character of SLIP escape sequence.

ESC_SEQ0_CHAR0.description: This register is used to define the first character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDB.

ESC_SEQ0_CHAR1.description: This register is used to define the second character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDD.

ESC_SEQ1.description: This register is used to define a character that need to be encoded. The default value is 0x11 that used as a flow control character.

ESC_SEQ1_CHAR0.description: This register is used to define the first character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDB.

ESC_SEQ1_CHAR1.description: This register is used to define the second character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDE.

ESC_SEQ2.description: This register is used to define a character that need to be decoded. The default value is 0x13 that used as a flow control character.

ESC_SEQ2_CHAR0.description: This register is used to define the first character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDB.

ESC_SEQ2_CHAR1.description: This register is used to define the second character of SLIP escape sequence. The default value is 0xDF.

PKT_THRS.description: This register is used to configure the maximum value of the packet length when UHCI_HEAD_EN is 0.

DATE.description: This is the version control register.
